loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and  school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to resupply with book bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.name: Elizaphan

texts.en:
Elizaphan is 57 years old and married to Ruth. He supports four children.

He has been a dairy farmer for the last 28 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily and meet both client and family needs.

He plans to use the gained profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His hope is to be financially stable and be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Humphey

texts.en:
Humphey operates a 9 acre farm  in Thika, where agriculture is the main economy. He is married and has 9 children. He relies on raising livestock and growing crops to earn money to meet his family's needs. He has 3 dairy cows, 4 poultry, and a vegetable garden. 

Kenyan farmers used reasonably-priced Indian motorcycles as the preferred means of farm transportation because of their affordability and agility. Humphey is seeking a loan to buy one of those. Your loan will enable him to access  markets in new geographical and economical regions. As a result, he will improve his income and productivity.
 
Your loan will enhance the quality of life of Humphey's family because he will have access to new markets and meet like-minded businessmen.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is in need of a loan to buy spare parts to sell. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married with four children and two of them are able to attend school. He built rentals and lodges that earn him supplementary income. Jackson is challenged by inadequate capital and wishes to educate his children to university.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a hardworking man who bakes  bread, mandazi, and doughnuts. He is married and has 6 children. He earns additional income from farming. 

He started the business to support his family and needs a loan to buy baking flour. He has inadequate capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Taguhi is farmer and mother of three infant children. Together with her husband Arkadi, they work hard to sustain their family. 

They keep three pigs and 18 piglets and also cultivate haricot, potato, pepper, and greens. Arkadi takes the gathered harvest to local markets and earns income for her family.

Taguhi asks for this loan to purchase special forage for the cattle (70 packages) needed for her farm. 

As this is Taguhi's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who don't have access to credit because they have no credit history. 

Through this joint initiative almost 500 borrowers like Taguhi get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for special forage for the cattle.

loans.name: Peace And Unity Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Peace and Unity and they are two women who are retailers. Their leader, Bernice, is 43 years old and has been selling groceries, ladies dresses and jeans for 15 years. Bernice is married and a mother. She supports her husband with the family expenses and her children's academic development. Her business consists of buying groceries (oil, rice, biscuit, sugar, etc.), ladies dresses and jeans to resell to her customers. If she is able to operate regularly, she is able to earn a considerable profit, which enables her to reinforce her working capital. In the future, she would like to improve her business further and to make her products known throughout the region.

Augustina has a paper and toiletry business and she is 61 years.

loans.use: to buy grocery items (oil, rice, biscuit, sugar, etc.), ladies dresses and jeans to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 35 years old and began her flower selling business this year, from her home in the rural town of El Carmen de Viboral, which is situated in the region of Rionegro. She works diligently every day of the week except for Sunday, so that she can spend time with her three beautiful children, who are 5, 6, and 9 years old. 

Jenny’s harvest has struggled to produce an adequate amount in recent years, and it has suffered from all kinds of weather issues, including droughts, extreme rains, and plagues. For this reason, she wishes to buy fertilizer, an irrigation system, and more cuttings so that she can recover from these former setbacks. 

She dreams of overcoming the difficulties that have confronted her business and especially wants to begin growing chrysanthemums again. Furthermore, she wishes to provide a brighter future for her children and pay for their education, whilst providing the whole family with a better home to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, an irrigation system, and more cuttings

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job was born in Mokopane in Limpopo Province in South Africa and has two brothers and four sisters. He is single but has a two-year-old son named Mpho. His mother receives an SASSA grant, and his father is a construction worker.

Job is earning a B.A. degree at Maharishi Institute in Business Management. He especially enjoys his classes in algebra, organization and management, and business law and ethics. In his spare time he plays soccer, watches documentaries that show how life and education is important and spends time with his family.

Upon graduation Job would like to start his own construction company. He would move anywhere to start his business, as traveling inspires him with more ideas.

Job is applying for a 18,675 ZAR loan through Kiva's field partner Maharishi Education for Invincibility Trust to help pay for one year of tuition plus living expenses. He will be able to pursue his studies stress-free, and the loan, as he said, “will be a life changer for me.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Lourenca

texts.en: Lourenca lives in Liquica. Her business is selling animals like pigs, goats and others. She is requesting a loan of $600 to help her increase her capital and buy more animals. She started her business in 2012. Selling animals is the daily activity of Lourenca. She hopes she will be able to sell more with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more animals to resell to the public

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
Yusara es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la manicura.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ 3000’ que se caracteriza por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, ubicado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Yusara es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la nuca, baja estatura, complexión física robusta,  su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada al centro, viste blusa celeste). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en el transporte, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, reparación tv color, venta de medicina natural, venta de refrescos, venta de fruta, artesanía en cerámica y venta de desayunos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la manicura; ella se ocupa del cuidado y embellecimiento de las manos y en especial del cuidado y pintura de las uñas. Trabaja de forma independiente en centros de estética y peluquerías. Entre sus ocupaciones se encuentran el corte, limpieza y pulido de las uñas de los clientes tanto de las manos como de los pies, “primero retiro la pintura anterior utilizando acetona o un líquido similar, Luego, corto y perfilo la forma de las uñas utilizando tijeras y limas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de material de trabajo como; Recipientes, jabón líquido, Lima de Madera, lima de uñas, Pulidor de uñas, esponja abrillantadora, esponja para pulir uñas, Removedor de Cutícula, Empujador para cutícula, Cortaúñas, Algodón, Quita esmalte, Alicate corta-cutícula, Aceite hidratante de cutícula, Base para uñas, Esmalte, Brillo secante, Crema hidratante para manos, Toallas limpias, Esterilizador y otros. Su sueño es abrir su propio salón de belleza, ella desea realizar la compra de material de manicura para continuar con su trabajo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Yusara solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de manicura para continuar con su trabajo y abrir un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Yusara is a 35 year old woman who lives with her husband, without children and her business is manicures.  She is enterprising, independent, understanding, patient, responsible, and very hard-working.  She operates her business in the zone 'Plan 3000'3000', which is known for its multicultural inhabitants (Aymarás, Quechuas and Guaraníes), and is located in the southern part of the city.  Migrants have taken over this area and have formed businesses that are constantly growing.  The climate is warm and tropical with temperatures that range between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Yusara is dark-skinned with brown eyes and long brown hair that she wears tied up behind her neck.  She is short with a robust physical complexion.  Her native language is Guarani, which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish with the general population and in her business.  (She is seated in the center wearing a light blue blouse.)

She shares her life with her husband who works in transportation and they live in a rented room, constructed of brick and cement with a metal roof and cement floor.  They have running water, electricity, and sewage.  

The need to improve her business led her to lead a group of lenders with businesses such as: food sales, TV repairs, natural medicine sales, snack sales, fruit sales, ceramic crafts, and breakfast sales, in order to request a loan and improve their businesses.

Her business is manicures, which deals with the care and beautification of hands and the special care and painting of fingernails.  She works independently in beauty centers and hair salons.  Among her tasks are cutting, cleaning, and polishing her customer's fingernails as well as toenails.  She explains, "First, I remove any previous polish using acetone or a similar solution.  Then, I cut and shape the nails using clippers and nail files..."

The advantage of her business is that she constantly has customers, but the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase work materials such as: basins, liquid soap, wooden files, nail files, nail polish, buffers, polishers, cuticle remover, nail clippers, cotton, polish remover, cuticle cutters, hydrating cuticle cream, base polish, enamel, drying spray, hydrating cream for hands, clean towels, sterilizers and others.  Her dream is to open her own beauty salon and she wants to purchase these manicure materials to continue with her work.

This is the first in a series of loans with the organization in the three years since she has developed this career.  It is for these motives that Yusara is requesting a loan to purchase manicure materials to continue her work and open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase materials for manicures to continue working and to open a beauty salon.

loans.name: Teonilda

texts.en:
Teonilda is a 46-year-old married woman from Badian, Cebu.  Her husband is a farmer and carpenter. She has raised hogs for ten years to help her husband meet their household needs. 

She will use the loan to purchase  feed and additional piglets. 

Teonilda knows how important it is to provide proper nutrition for her animals.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce used the previous loan to buy cassava flour, cooking oil, and sweet bananas to increase the number of pancakes baked daily.

She is farmer and sells fresh foods.   This business provides self-employment. 

Joyce has asked for a loan to buy fresh food to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh food for sell.

loans.name: Wilson Alexander

texts.en:
Wilson is a 21-year-old man and lives in the rural village of El Carmen de Viboral, found in the Rionegro region. He has sold cattle since 2012.

He is extremely hard working and attends to his animals every day of the week except for Sunday (to spend time with the rest of his family). He will use the loan to buy more cattle. He want his business to become more competitive.  

Wilson dreams of creating a sustainable and successful enterprise, buy a home, and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Matunda Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Joseph, a member of Matunda Self Help Group. He is 59 years old and married with four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

Joseph grows maize, beans and potatoes. With the training he got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he has been able to commercialize his farming business and is now able to get more profits out of it, unlike before. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. This will improve his income and hence be in a position to educate his children and provide for his family's needs.

He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for their support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. This will improve his income and hence be in a position to educate his children and provide for his family needs.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann has finished paying off her previous Kiva loan. She was able to increase her income, which helped her pay for her family’s needs such as food and school fees for her child.

Ann is taking out another loan, this for 15,000 KES, from Kiva's field partner Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to start raising chickens. She anticipates her business will thrive and give her a steady supply of chicken and eggs to sell. This will help supplement her income and continue to contribute to the family’s welfare.

Ann is grateful to Kiva for its support and promises to pay off her loan promptly.

loans.use: to start raising chickens

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson has a 1-acre  farm in Nandi Hills, Kenya where agriculture is the main economic activity.  He raises livestock and grows crops to provide for the needs of his family.  He has 2 dairy cows, 10 chickens, 250 trees, tea, and maize. 

He is married and has 1 child.  

Kenyan farmers use reasonably-priced Indian motorcycles as the preferred means of farm transportation because of their affordability and agility. Dickson requests a loan to buy a motorcycle. The vehicle will enable him to access markets in new geographical and economical regions, and improve his income and productivity.
 
The loan will enable Dickson to access new markets for his produce and provide contact with like-minded business owners.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Okindo

texts.en:
Okindo is a smallholder farmer residing in Masaba division, Kenya. He is mainly into crop farming but also has enough skill in dairy, tree, and crop farming. He has been doing this business for five years. His strength as a horticultural farmer lies in his ability to predict changing weather patterns.

Okindo needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements to enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he is facing is lack of financial products tailored for his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva.

Okindo is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers, and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. Your loan will help him acquire agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest and quality yields. 

Income from this investment will help him to meet his obligations as the head of the family and family business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and implements

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a retail business where he sells household items. His primary customers are locals. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

He hopes that, in the future, he will have a large scale business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 31-year-old married man. He lives in Masindi, Uganda and he has got the responsibility of taking care of three children. 

He practices farming and grows maize and beans for both sale and consumption. Khalid bought an oxen to help him to generate income. He is challenged by weather vagaries.

He is requesting a loan to weed his field and buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to weed his field and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell and pay school fees.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.en:
Carlos is a 28-year-old man who lives in Ciudad Bolívar.  He provides for his 3 year old son by running a store to sell drinks, confectionary items, and cleaning products. 

He wants to expand his stock and purchase snacks, groceries and toiletries. 

Carlos has many aspirations for his business, which include increasing his sales and clientele, formalizing his store, and creating an environment which will lead to long term success. He is motivate to provide a new home and a bright future for his son.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, groceries, and toiletries.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, 32 years old, is from Samtredia district. She has a husband, two school-aged sons and a pensioner grandmother. The family has income from its business activity. Specifically, Nino heads a bakery where she works on her own and sells her products to the local people. However, she finds it hard to cover all the family's expenses and wants to start another business to more effectively meet all costs. A loan of USD 3,500 will be a great help to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to purchase a stock of products and open a general store locally. Nino's husband will work there as a salesman and will generate significant income for their family's well-being.

After the general store is open, the family will have another stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With the support of the Startup program, the family's living conditions will greatly improve.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of products to open a general store.

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.en:
Marta is 35 years old and lives in El Bagre, located in northern Antioquia, where she sells fruit juice to the local community. She is extremely hardworking, and she can be found selling her juice every working day of the week for up to nine hours a day. 

With her loan, she wishes to buy two more smoothie machines, repair her preparation table which is rapidly falling apart, and purchase more products so that she can offer her customers a greater range of juices.

She hopes that this loan will allow her to open her first store, whilst increasing her sales and income, and allow her to realize her dream of buying herself a better home to live in.

loans.use: to buy two more smoothie machines and repair her preparation table

loans.name: Kékéli

texts.fr: Kékéli est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans  et vit à Baguida. Mère de deux enfants, Kékéli est très entreprenante et dynamique. Kékéli fait les soins de beauté à ses clients afin de trouver son gain. Kékéli s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des vernis et des produits de soins de beauté, Kékéli demande ce crédit pour réaliser son objectif et satisfaire davantage ses clients afin d’avoir un bon profit.
texts.en: Kékéli is a married, 28 year old woman and lives in Baguida with two children. Kékéli is very entrepreneurial and dynamic. Kékéli does beauty styling for her clients to make her living. Kékéli resupplies once a month at the market. Kékéli is requesting this loan to buy nail polish and beauty products in order to achieve her goals of further satisfying her clients and making a good profit.

loans.use: to buy 30 nail polishes and 8 pomades.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 42-year-old married womanfrom Alegria, Cebu.  She has two  children who are 10 and 12 years old.  

Nida operates a Sari-sari (variety) store business and raises hogs.   She also grows vegetables.  Her husband is a construction worker.

Nida will use the loan to buy fertilizer, feed, eggs, canned goods, soy sauce, milk, coffee and sugar.

Nida would like to expand her business and obtain a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed, eggs, canned goods, soy sauce, milk, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Phineas

texts.en:
Phineas has a small farm in Nduruma, Kenya. He grows crops and raises poultry and goats. He started farming last year and is optimistic about his future. 

He needs a loan to purchase farm inputs for the coming season. The main challenge  is lack of finances tailored for his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva.

Phineas will use the loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides. Your loan will help Phineas to acquire agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest. 

Income from this investment will help him to meet his obligations as the head of the family business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Kiptanui

texts.en:
Kiptanui is a smallholder farmer based in Nandi Hills, which is a rain-fed area of Kenya where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. He is married and has four children. He relies on livestock and crop farming to provide for the needs of his family. On his 11 acre farm, today you will find three dairy cows, 10 hens, 3000 trees, tea, maize, and beans.

Among Kenyan smallholder farmers, reasonably-priced Indian motorcycles are the preferred means of farm transportation because of their affordability and agility. Kiptanui is seeking a loan to buy such a motorcycle. Your loan will enable him to access formal markets in new geographical and economical regions. As a result, he will improve his income and agricultural productivity in the long run.

Your loan will enhance the quality of life of Kiptanui's family since the newly-acquired asset will create new markets for his produce and facilitate interactions among them and other actors in the agriculture value chain.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Angilyne

texts.en:
Angilyne is a 26-year-old woman from Malabuyoc, Cebu. She has two children, who are 2 and 7 years old. 

Her partner works in another country to provide for them. She in turn helps by raising hogs to earn a living. For two years, this has been her business and it allows her to earn about PHP 6,000 per month. 

She is requesting a loan to buy feed and pay for school expenses. 

Angilyne hopes to make her business a success for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy feed and pay school fees

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: A 31 ans, Ayélé est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Ayélé vit dans le quartier de Baguida et pour répondre aux besoins de la famille, Ayélé vend herbes et plantes servant à la préparation de la tisane et des médicaments. Ayélé s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Ayélé nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des tas de plantes afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ayélé, 31 years old, is a married woman and mother of three children, living in Baguida. To respond to the needs of the family, Ayélé sells herbs and plants used to make healthy teas and natural medicines. Ayélé resupplies once a month at the market. Ayélé needs this loan to buy some bundles of plants in order to make more profit and to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 250 bundles of plants.

loans.name: Constantine

texts.en:
Constantine is a smallholder farmer residing in Sigowet division, Kenya. He is mainly involved in banana farming, but he has interest in other crops such as tea and vegetables. His strength as a horticultural farmer lies in his ability to predict changing weather patterns.

Constantine needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements to enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he is facing is lack of financial products tailored to his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva.

Constantine is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizer, and other important inputs. Your loan will help Constantine acquire the agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest and quality yields. 

Income from this investment will help him to meet his obligations as the head of the family and family business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a smallholder farmer based in Nandi Hills, which is a rain-fed area of Kenya where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. He is married and has four children. He relies on livestock and crop farming to provide for the needs of his family. On his 1.5-acre farm today, you will find three dairy cows, 12 heads of poultry and a tea garden. 

Among Kenyan smallholder farmers, reasonably priced Indian motorcycles are the preferred means of farm transportation because of their affordability and agility. Timothy is seeking a loan to buy one of those. Your loan will enable him to access formal markets in new geographical and economical regions. As a result, he will improve his income and agricultural productivity in the long run. 

Your loan will enhance the quality of life of Timothy's family, since the newly acquired asset will create new markets for their produce and facilitate interactions among them and other actors in the agriculture value chain.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Soleil B Group

texts.fr: Mupenda est commerçante, présidente du groupe solidaire «Soleil B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un chauffeur, âgée de 49 ans, mère de 7 enfants dont 6 étudient et 1 n’étudie plus. Elle est vendeuse des articles manufacturés dans un magasin de la place depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en matelas, pagnes, souliers dames, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mupenda, age 49, is a merchant and president of the Soleil B group. She is a client of Hekima. She is married to a driver, and they have seven children, six of them in school and the other one no longer studying.  

She has been selling manufactured consumer goods in a local shop for the past two years. She plans to buy mattresses, pagnes, ladies’ shoes, etc.  

Her goals are to bolster her activity, to feed her children and to support their studies. 

She thanks Hekima for helping entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy mattresses, pagnes, ladies' footwear, etc. for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a smallholder farmer based in Molo, which is a rain-fed area of Kenya where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. He relies on livestock and crop farming to provide for the needs of his family. John's biggest challenge, besides lack of access to financial services, is the expensive cost of transporting his produce to the market.

Among Kenyan smallholder farmers, reasonably-priced Indian motorcycles are the preferred means of farm transportation because of their affordability and agility. John is seeking a loan to buy one such motorcycle. Your loan will enable him access to formal markets in new geographical and economical regions. As a result, he will improve his income and agricultural productivity in the long run.

Your loan will enhance the quality of life of John's family since the newly acquired asset will create new markets for their produce and facilitate interactions among them and other actors in the agriculture value chain.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Marip

texts.en:
Marip is a 25-year-old married man from the village of Kapanakhchi. He lives with his wife, who is involved in a clothing trading business. 

Marip has no stable activity and is engaged in sheep breeding. He sells the sheep seasonally at good prices. He wants to get a stable source of income and do his bit for the family's welfare. 

All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Marip applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Marip will buy a secondhand car and start providing taxi service through the district. 

He is a very hardworking and motivated man who will do his best to tackle the financial difficulties and make living conditions better for his family. 

Marip and his wife will be very thankful to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Oniris Del Carmen

texts.en:
Oniris is 26 years old and lives in the north Antioquian municipality of El Bagre, where she has been running a clothes store for the past 5 years. She is a serious entrepreneur and runs her business without any other help, every day of the week, for 12 hours.

She wishes to use this loan so that she can buy more merchandise, and also to purchase more appealing signs for the store so that she can attract more customers and therefore increase her sales.

Oniris dreams of having a better life for herself and her future family, and she hopes that her hard work will one day allow her to pay for her children’s education and help buy a home in which they can live.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, and also to purchase more appealing signs for the store

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 40 years old and married with three children. Sam is an agriculturalist who majors in dairy farming and cattle fattening. He owns about 50 cows: 10 for milk and 40 for fattening and later sale. Sam has applied for a loan of 3,500,000 UGX to construct a dam to maintain a steady supply of water on his farm for his animals as his major challenge in the dry season since most of them are affected by the dry season.

His dream is to be the leading supplier of quality milk and beef in his region.

He is honest and hardworking and appreciates the financial boost and support.

loans.use: To construct a dam

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
A USD 800 loan is offered to Romana to improve her business. 

Romana opened her kiosk in 2006 with her own working capital of USD 500. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store to sell, like oil, sleepers, detergent, and soap. Romana is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Romana is living in Liquica with her family.

loans.use: to buy sleepers, cooking oil, biscuits, soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hog feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for laborers and purchase construction materials

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es el tejido de mantas de alpaca.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, optimista, luchadora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad ‘Batallas’ que se encuentra a una altura aproximada de 3,800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, es un sitio turístico, ubicada a 87 kilómetros de la ciudad y su medio principal de transporte es la lancha y otros medios de navegación, de clima frío y seco.
Veronica es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que trabajan, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba y energía eléctrica. Su negocio es el tejido de mantas de alpaca; las mantas son piezas rectangulares de tejido que sirve para cubrir del frío. La Alpaca es una fibra ligera, cálida, resistente y suave, compite con ventaja ante fibras más utilizadas como la lana de oveja o el mohair, “La apariencia de la lana de alpaca es muy parecida al pelo humano y tiene un aspecto denso y lustroso...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de lana por mayor. Su sueño es abrir un taller de tejidos grande y completo, ella desea realizar la compra de lana por mayor para contar con material de trabajo constante. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Veronica solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para continuar con su negocio y abrir un taller de tejidos.
texts.en:
Veronica is a 23 year old woman who is single and has no children.  Her business is weaving blankets from alpaca wool.  She is enterprising, independent, dependable, optimistic, determined, responsible and very hard-working.  She operates her business in the "Batallas" (Battles) area, which is located at an altitude of approximately 3,800 meters above sea level.  It's a tourist site, located 87 kilometers from the city and her main method of transportation is by boat.  The climate is cold and dry.

Veronica is dark-skinned, with brown eyes and long, black hair that she braids.  She is short, with a medium complexion and she dresses traditionally wearing a hat, scarf, and skirt.  Her native language is Aymara which she speaks at home, and she also speaks Spanish for the broader culture and for her business.

She shares her life with her family members with whom she works.  They live in a room that is property of the family and constructed of brick and cement with a metal roof.  They have electricity and a well that uses a pump to get water.  

Her business is weaving blankets from alpaca wool.  The blankets are rectangular pieces of cloth that serve for covering up in the cold.  Alpaca wool is a light fiber, warm, resistant, and soft, and has advantages over more utilized fibers such as sheeps wool or mohair. She comments that " The appearance of alpaca wool is very similar to human hair and is dense and shiny.

The advantage of her business is that she has constant customers, but the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase the wool wholesale.  Her dream is to open a large and complete weaving workshop and she wants to purchase the wool wholesale to have the materials she needs for work on hand.  

This is the first in a sequence of loans with the organization in the 10 years that she's been developing this trade.  It is for these reasons that Veronica is requesting a loan to purchase alpaca wool wholesale to continue with her business and open a weaving workshop.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool wholesale to continue her business and open a weaving workshop.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a smallholder farmer residing in Kaplamai division, Kenya. He is mainly into crop farming but also has enough skin in dairy and tree farming. He started farming 45 years ago. His strength as a horticultural farmer lies in his ability to predict changing weather patterns.

Stanley needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements to enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he is facing is the lack of financial products tailored for his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva.

Stanley is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. Your loan will help Stanley acquire agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest and quality yields.

Income from this investment will help him to meet his obligations as the head of the family and family business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Judit

texts.en:
Judit is applying for a loan of $ 1000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has been running her kiosk since 2013 with a starting capital of $250.  She will use this loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as fish canes, oil, sugar, biscuits and rice. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Judit is living in Liquica town. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Sindy Carolina

texts.es:
Sindy una joven con 23 años de edad, soltera y madre de un hijo de 3 años, trabajadora y humilde, trabaja vendiendo mercancía en Yarumal, un medio por el cual ella puede sostenerse y mantener a su hijo.

El sueño de esta joven es formalizar su negocio para dejárselo a su hijo, y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Ella solicito un préstamo con el cual abastecerá su negocio de productos  marca Amway lo que le generara mas ventas y aumentara sus clientes.
 
Usted puede ser parte de este sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Sindy is a 23 year-old single, working mother of a 3 year-old son. She is humble and works selling merchandise in Yarumal, a means by which she can support herself and take care of her son. 

This young woman's dream is to formalize her business in order to leave it to her son and to improve the condition of her home.

She is asking for a loan with which she will stock her business with Amway products, thereby generating more sales and increasing her clientele.

You can be part of this dream; give a loan.

loans.use: to purchase personal products.

loans.name: Elvia Engelines

texts.en:
Elvia is 36 years old and lives in in the municipality of Apartadó, located in western Antioquia, where she sells chickens to the local community. She has three beautiful, young daughters who she provides for by working determinedly every day of the week.

With the loan, she would like to increase her sales and clientele by buying more chickens and chicken feed, as well as a sufficient-sized ranch in which they can roost.

Whilst suffering from illness has made working difficult for Elvia, nothing will stop her from realizing her dream of providing her daughters with better living conditions and a brighter future. Your help can bring her closer to this dream!

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Thùy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thùy is 23 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for four years. Thùy lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2014, Thùy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thùy has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Thùy hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Kazozakeza Group

texts.fr:
Ernestine  fait partie du groupe  kazozakeza  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 25 ans et est mariée à Ignace  un commercant. Ensemble ils ont  2  enfants.

Elle fait le commerce de riz, haricot, patate douce,…dans son restaurant depuis  30 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot,et de riz à revendre  cuits dans son restaurant,  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  acheter du bétail pour faire l’élevage.
texts.en:
Ernestine is a member of the group "Kazozakeza" and she lives in Gitega. She is 25 years old and is married to Ignace, a merchant. Together, they have two children. 

Ernestine has been selling rice, beans, and baked potatoes in her restaurant for 30 years. 

She is on her third loan with Turame. With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy bulk quanitities of beans and rice to prepare in her restaurant for a profit. 

In the coming years, she would like to buy some livestock to raise.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy bulk quantities of beans and rice for her restaurant.

loans.name: Miguel De Jesús

texts.es: Miguel es un joven que su gusto por la culinaria le permitió iniciar su propio negocio de comidas desde la comodidad de su hogar, él inició con una clientela muy limitada sin embargo su buena sazón y  disposición para las ventas le permitieron ampliar su base de clientes, tanto que hoy en día provee de almuerzos, cenas y meriendas a empleados de empresas aledañas además de sus vecinos y amigos.  Su principal desafío fue iniciar con un escaso capital sin embargo ha logrado continuar con su negocio y en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en víveres; aceite, carne, pollo, pescado, cerdo, atún y demás, que utilizará en la preparación de sus comidas.  Su meta a futuro es tener un local e inaugurar su restaurante.
texts.en: Miguel is a young man who because of his love of cooking started his own business preparing meals. He works from the comfort of his own home. He began with a small number of customers but with experience and sales he has expanded his number of customers. Today he provides lunches, dinners, and snacks to employees of the area's businesses in addition to his neighbors and friends. His main obstacle was to start with little capital but he was able to continue with his business and today is applying for a loan with Kiva. This is his first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy supplies, oil, meat, chicken, fish, pork, tuna, and other items used in meal preparation. His goal for the future is to have his own commercial locale and open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies, oil, meat, chicken, fish, pork, tuna, and other items used in meal preparation

loans.name: Pastor Dario

texts.es:
Pastor, a sus 48 años de edad, es un hombre casado con una hija de 15 años de edad. Inicio un negocio de salsamentaría por la gran necesidad de conseguir los recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia, esta actividad la aprendió solo.

Allí trabaja solo todos los días, logrando generar los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar. 

El sueño de pastor es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar bebidas y alimentos al por mayor.

Tú puedes contribuir a este sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Pastor, at the age of 48, is a married man with a 15 year old daughter. He started his deli business because of the huge need to come up with the resources to support his family. He learned this trade by himself.

He works there every day, managing to generate sufficient income to cover his household's basic needs.

Pastor's dream is to improve the condition of his home.

Currently he's requesting help for this loan with which he wants to purchase wholesale beverages and food.

You can contribute to this dream, make a loan.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale beverages and food for his store.

loans.name: Tembwet Mauche Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Florence, a member of Tembwet Mauche Self Help Group. She is married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in June 2013.

Florence is a maize and potato farmer. She is grateful to HiH EA for inculcating an entrepreneurial culture in its members through training and mentorship. This has enabled her to pursue farming as a business.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for the upcoming planting season. She hopes that with these inputs she will get a better harvest at the end of the season, enough for both her family's consumption and her business, hence enabling her to support her family's needs.

Florence is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer, to enable her to increase her income and thus meet her family's needs with ease.

loans.name: Astrid Del Carmen

texts.en:
Astríd Del Carmen is 37 years old and lives in Tierralta, situated in the region of Cordoba. She has been running a store since 2008, which helps her provide for her 11 and 6-year-old daughters. Unfortunately, the store has recently come under tough times and because of this Astríd Del Carmen works for up to 14 hours a day, Monday through Sunday.

She wishes to create a more lucrative business and to increase her profits. Specifically, she would like to have greater sustainability by purchasing a freezer, more shelves, and extra stock.

Her motivation comes from the desire to provide her two beautiful girls with a brighter future and a greater quality of life. With your help, she make this dream come true!

loans.use: to purchase a freezer, more shelves, and extra stock for her store.

loans.name: Patima

texts.en:
Patima is a 49-year-old married woman from village Pereta. She lives with her husband and brother-in-law. Patima requested a loan from local financial institutions several times but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. The only source of income for the family is a small-scale family agricultural business. They grow nuts and grapes on a family-owned plot of land and they also have a dairy cow. They sell milk products, nuts and wine at the local market. Patima requested a loan from Credo to expand their agribusiness and make it more productive. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Patima and her husband will build a greenhouse and start harvesting greens and vegetables.
The expanded business will be a great support for family members and they will tackle their financial difficulties.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and expand her agribusiness.

loans.name: Luz Guadalupe

texts.es: Luz tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su  hijo de 13 años de edad. Luz es una mujer  emprendedora que hace todo lo que esté en sus manos para dar a su familia lo necesario. Luz se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de forma ambulante desde hace cuatro años y de esta forma lleva el pan de cada día hasta  su hogar. Luz anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual utilizo para la compra de ladrillo cemento y grava pero el monto solicitado no le alcanzo a cubrir todos los gastos de los materiales es  por ello que con el deseo de seguir la mejora de su vivienda y sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para seguir invirtiendo en la construcción de las paredes de su vivienda dado que por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, polines, lámina, puertas y ventanas.
texts.en:
Luz is 27 years old, and lives in a house of her own with her partner and 13 year old son. Luz is an enterprising woman who does everything she can to provide her family what they need. She has worked in the sale of natural products as a street vendor for four years and this is how she has put food on the table.

Previously Luz applied for a loan which she used to buy bricks, cement, and gravel but the sum she applied for wasn't enough to cover all of the material expenses. So that's why she wants to continue with her home improvement and her standard of living, and she's decided to apply for a new loan from FUSAI to continue investing in building the walls of her home, which she has been unable to finish due to a lack of resources. With the sum she's applied for she'll buy cement, sand, wooden beams, sheet metal, doors, and windows.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, wooden beams, sheet metal, doors, and windows.

loans.name: Maraga

texts.en:
Maraga is a smallholder farmer residing in the Kisii area of Kenya. He is mainly into crop farming but also does dairy and poultry farming. He is a renowned banana grower since 2003. His strength as a horticultural farmer lies in his ability to predict changing weather patterns.

Maraga needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements to enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he is facing is lack of financial products tailored for his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva.

Maraga is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. Your loan will help Maraga acquire agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest and quality yields.  Income from this investment will help him to meet his obligations as the head of the family and family business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and beans at wholesale and in this way maintain her customers until harvest

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 54 years old. She is a widower. She owns a shop and she has been in business for the past 20 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt,soap and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and improve her business.

loans.use: buy beans, sorghum & maize

loans.name: Dusabayezu

texts.en: Dusabeyezu is 28 years old. He is married and has two children aged between 6 months and 5 years, one of them go to school. He owns a shop and he has been in a business for the past 1 year. His wife is also a business lady. With this loan, he would like to buy more sugar, salt and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and make savings in a same business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and soaps for sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a smallholder farmer residing in Okorongo division, Kenya. He is mainly into crop farming but also does dairy, poultry, goat and tree farming. He is a renowned pineapple and tea grower who started his farm 20 years ago. His strength as a horticultural farmer lies in his ability to predict changing weather patterns.

James needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements to enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he is facing is lack of financial products tailored for his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva.

James is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. Your loan will help James acquire agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest and quality yields.   Income from this investment will help him to meet his obligations as the head of the family and family business.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and implements

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 32 years old. He is married and has one child who is one month old. He owns a mini-market and he has been in a business for the past 5 years. His wife is a business lady also. With this loan, he would like to buy more yoghurt, milk and cakes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: buyt yoghurt, milk and cakes

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a smallholder farmer residing in Likoyan division, Kenya. He is mainly into crop farming but also does dairy, poultry and tree farming on a small scale. He started farming last year and he is optimistic the future holds much in store for him. 

Jackson needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements to enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he is facing is lack of financial products tailored for his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva.

Jackson is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. Your loan will help Jackson acquire agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest and quality yields. Income from this investment will help him to meet his obligations as the head of the family and family business.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Wilson De Jesus

texts.es:
Wilson un hombre de 36 años, se dedica a trabajar en una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar en Santa Elena.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y así comprarse una vivienda.

Solicito un crédito en la Corporación Interactuar para abastecer su negocio comprando productos de consumo diario.

Quiere seguir creciendo y expandir su negocio, con su apoyo Wilson podrá seguir su sueño.
texts.en: Wilson is a 36 year old man. He works in a grocery store in Santa Elena that stocks basic needs items. His dream is to continue working and in this way buy himself a house. He seeks a loan from Interactuar to buy basic groceries to stock his grocery store with these daily need items. He wants to continue growing and expanding his business. With your support Wilson will be able to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to buy basic groceries to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.en:
Maria is 66 years old and runs a manufacturing business from her home in Itagüí, a municipality situated just south of Medellín. She has two sons, and has been producing clothes since 2000 with the assistance of her daughter.

She aims to purchase two more sewing machines and extra material so that she can increase her stock and produce new products, as well as improve her sales and hence become more competitive in the local market.

Through expanding her business, Maria dreams of buying a new home and improving her living conditions. You can help make it happen!

loans.use: to purchase two more sewing machines and extra material

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en: Silvia has been involved in business activities since 2009.  She started with her own working capital of $150.  She resells medicine to people in front of her house and she taking a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin.  She will buy additional medicine with the loan.

loans.use: buy medicine products

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable is a 42-year-old hardworking married woman with 6 children and 2 dependents who are orphans.

Mable is an agriculturalist who deals in farming, mainly rearing pigs and goats and cattle fattening. She is honest and hardworking.   Together with her husband she has managed to look after their family, and especially has managed to pay school fees for her 3 daughters at university. 

Mable is applying for a loan of UGX 2,000 to buy feed for her piggery project and also buy fertilizers and other farm inputs for her banana plantation.

Mable’s dream is to see all her children graduate from university.

loans.use: buy feed and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for his home in order to improve his farming business and improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia de 37 años es una emprendedora mujer que en compañía de su madre inició su tienda de víveres y miscelánea;  gracias a la experiencia que su mamá ha tenido al trabajar en negocios de este mismo formato, le propuso a Claudia asociarse e iniciar su sueño de prosperidad.  Hoy en día cuenta con seis años de funcionamiento y una clientela fidelizada, quienes todos los días a partir de las 6 a.m. realizan sus compras de productos de la canasta familiar a buenos precios y con la mejor calidad.  Con el propósito de mantener un llamativo surtido en su miscelánea y aprovisionarse de víveres, frutas, verduras y carnes para su tienda, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Con esta inversión pretende incrementar las ventas para así generar más ingresos para su familia.  Claudia es madre de un hijo y su meta a largo plazo es remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en: Claudia is a 37 year old enterprising woman who started a basic store with her mother. Thanks to the experience that her mother had working in a similar business, Claudia's mother proposed to her to start a business and dream of prosperity. Today their store has been open for 6 years with a steady clientele, who every day starting at 6 AM begin their shopping to buy high quality items at good prices. With the goal of maintaining a good variety of stock, she is applying for a loan from Kiva to buy stock for her store including basic staple items, fruits, vegetables, and meat. This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this investment she intends to increase sales to generate more income for her family. Claudia is the mother of one son and her long term goal is to remodel her home.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store including basic staple items, fruits, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: María Rosalba

texts.es:
A sus 66 años la señora Rosalba, es soltera y con un hijo de 38 años de edad, debido a que no cuenta con la ayuda de un familiar se dedica a laborar en un taller de confecciones en su casa, trabaja de lunes a sábado 7 horas diarias.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y así poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa.

Con el préstamo ella comprara mas tela, botones y cierres al por mayor, así sus ventas mejoraran y sus ingresos aumentaran.

Con su apoyo Rosalba podrá seguir su sueño.
texts.en: 66 year old Rosalba is single with a 38 year old son. Since she didn't have help from her family she worked as a seamstress in her home. she works Monday through Saturday, 7 hours daily. Her dream is to continue working and be able to improve her living conditions in her home. With the loan she will buy more fabric, buttons and zippers at wholesale, thus her sales and income will improve. With your support Rosalba will be able to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, buttons and zippers at wholesale, thus her sales and income will improve.

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.fr: Mihako est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Grace», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 52 ans, mère 8 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des poissons frais  dans un marché secondaire de la place depuis 20 ans. Elle tira son premier capital après recolte dans son champ, car son conjoint est chomeur. Elle va s’approvisionner en 400 poissons. Elle souhaite continuer à scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Mihako is a shopkeeper and a member of Grace Group, clients of the MFI [microfinance institution] Hekima. She is married, 52 years old, and the mother of eight children who all attend school. Mihako has been selling fresh fish in a second-hand market in the [town] square for 20 years. She will withdraw her first loan after the harvest of her field, because her husband is unemployed. Mihako will purchase 400 fish. She hopes to continue paying for her children's food and education. In closing, Mihako would like to thank Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase 400 fish.

loans.name: Blanca Paulina

texts.es:
Blanca es una joven madre de 24 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo en casa de sus padres, cuenta con un pequeño departamento donde comparte con su hija.
Blanca se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y meriendas, adquirió experiencia gracias a su madre, luego se independizó; ahora atiende todas las tardes en una vía principal de la ciudad, comenta que le va muy bien, con ello ha podido ir incrementando su negocio poco a poco.
Blanca solicita crédito para cambiar las dos cocinas industriales que están un poco viejas, además desea adecuar el kiosco que tiene, mejorarlo ya que desea ponerlo más seguro para guardar sus activos.
Está feliz, porque podrá mejorar mucho la apariencia del negocio, así mejorar sus ventas atrayendo más clientela. Así mejorar sus ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su hija.
texts.en:
Blanca is a young 24 year old mother who lives in the city of Santo Domingo in her parents' house. She shares a small apartment with her daughter.

Blanca works selling sausage and potato dishes and snacks. She got experience thanks to her mother and then became independent, and now every evening she does business at one of the city's main streets. She says it's going well for her, and has been able to expand her business bit by bit. Blanca applied for a loan to replace her two stoves, which are a bit old, and in addition she wants to fix up her kiosk and improve it because she wants to make it more secure to protect her assets.

She's happy because she'll be able to really improve her business' appearance, and that way improve her sales by attracting more customers. This would increase her income and enable her to support her daughter.

loans.use: To replace the stoves and improve the kiosk, so she'll be able to support her daughter.

loans.name: Fatima Magdalena

texts.es:
Fátima tiene 41 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos, dos de ellas mujeres y dos menores, una ya trabaja y les ayuda con pequeños ingresos para el hogar.
Fátima junto con su esposo trabajan, ella cuenta con un local donde arrienda y vende variedades como productos de bazar, juguetes y demás, mientras su esposo trabaja en el comercio de madera.
Fátima es clienta de Fundación Alternativa, gracias a su primer crédito ella pudo invertir en el negocio, adquirió nuevas vitrinas y mercadería, está feliz porque ha mejorado la apariencia de su local; ahora con este crédito podrá comprar mercadería para la temporada estudiantil, como mochilas, cartucheras,  útiles escolares, moños, diademas y demás. Necesita seguirse capitalizando y aprovechar esta temporada que es buena para crecer y mejorar su negocio, así seguirá apoyando en los ingresos del hogar y poder mantener a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fátima is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and children, two of her daughters are adults and two of them are children. One of her daughters works and helps out with her small earnings for the household. Fátima, together with her spouse, works. She rents a small store space where  she sells various bazaar merchandise, toys, and other items. Her husband works selling wood. 

Fátima is a client of the Fundación Alternativa. Thanks to her first loan, she was able to invest in her business. She acquired new glass showcases and merchandise. She is happy because she has improved the appearance of her store. Now, with this loan, she will buy merchandise for the back-to-school season such as backpacks, wallets, school supplies, headbands, ribbons, and other items. She needs to continue capitalizing and take advantage of the season, which is good for growing and improving her business. She will keep supporting her family and their household expenses to be able to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the back-to-school season and diversify her products in order to increase her customer base.

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.es:
Un almacén de ropa y artículos varios son es lo que mantiene viva la ilusión de Claudia, ya que su sueño es salir adelante, mejorar su situación económica y sostener a su familia, pues considera que lo mas importante en la vida es el trabajo duro y la perseverancia.
Trabaja incansablemente todos durante 6 horas para generar su propio sustento. 

Ella nunca pensó en que podía crecer y ahora que interactuar le da la oportunidad de prestarle dinero, quiere aprovechar para realizar la compra de ropa para bebe, ayudándole a conseguir más clientes para que se antojen de los artículos que tiene para ellos.
texts.en:
A baby's clothing and accessories store is what keeps Claudia's dream alive. Her dream is to move forward, improve her economic circumstances, and provide for her family. She considers hard work and perseverance to be the most important things in life. She works tirelessly during her 6-hour days in order to generate income for her family. 

Claudia never thought that she could grow and now that she has the opportunity of this loan, she wants to take advantage of it to buy more baby's clothing, helping her to obtain more customers so that they can enjoy the items she has for them.

loans.use: to buy more stock of baby's clothing.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Zavala Província de Inhambane tem 60 anos de idade vive maritalmente pai de 4 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelo seu neto e uma sobrinha que vivem em sua casa. 
É proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial a mais de 10 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Pois para satisfazer a necessidade dos seus clientes solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo produtos da primeira necessidade como: feijão, arroz, açúcar, amendoim e outros que forem necessários. Este é o seu 8º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende melhorar o seu estabelecimento comercial ampliando-a e construir dependências para aluguer. O seu principal desafio é adquirir uma viatura para transportar a sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Born in Zavala province in Inhambane, he is 60 years old is married and is the father of four minor children. He is responsible for his grandson and one niece that live in his house.

He has owned a commercial establishment for more than 10 years. There he earns an amount that he uses for his household expenses. In order to satisfy his customers' needs he is requesting a loan to increase the size of his business by acquiring staple goods like beans, rice, sugar, peanuts and others that are necessary. This is his eighth loan with Hluvuku.

In the future he intends to improve his commercial establishment, expanding it, and building a room to rent. His main challenge is acquiring a vehicle to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, peanuts, and others.

loans.name: Margarita Cecilia

texts.es:
Margarita una señora con 50 años de edad, casada con dos hijas de 15 y 17 años de edad se dedica a trabajar en confecciones y así lograr cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

El sueño de margarita es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando.

Con el préstamo solicitado por la Corporación Interactuar ella abastecerá su negocio con tela de alta costura para satisfacer pedidos y necesidades.

Impacte la vida de Margarita y la de su familia con un préstamo.
texts.en:
Margarita is 50 years old, married with two daughters, ages 15 and 17. She is a seamstress. and manages to cover her household's basic necessities in this way.

Margarita's dream is to improve the condition of her home, as over time it has gradually deteriorated.

With the loan requested from Interactuar she will supply her business with high fashion fabric for meeting orders and other needs.

The loan will have a positive impact on Margarita's life and that of her family.

loans.use: To stock her business with high fashion fabric for meeting orders and other needs.

loans.name: Jesus Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio un señor de 48 años casado y con dos hijos de 15 y 19 años de edad, por necesidad económica junto con su esposa realizan trabajos de campo pero por motivo de las fuertes lluvias y la sequia su cosecha se ve afectada lo cual hace que su estabilidad económica no sea tan buena.

El sueño de esta pareja es poder pagarles la educación a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Con el préstamo, Emilio comprara maquinas fuciladoras, lo cual ayudara a incrementar sus ganancias.

Aporte a este sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Emilio is a 48 year old man. He is married and has two children, aged 15 and 19. Out of financial necessity, he and his wife work in the fields, but due to strong rains and drought, his crop was affected. This makes his financial stability not be so good.

This couple's dream is to be able to pay for their children's education and improve their living conditions.

With the loan, Emilio will buy fumigating machines, which will help increase his earnings.

Contribute to this dream, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy fumigating machines, which will increase his earnings.

loans.name: Nancy Patricia

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer ecuatoriana, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, provincia de Cotopaxi, vive en una zona rural de la cuidad, donde hay un clima frio. Nancy tiene 32 años de edad y es felizmente casada con Juan, con quien procreó  dos hermosos hijos. Se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, que la trae de la frontera con Perú, esta actividad le permite llevar los recursos económicos necesarios para el sustento de su familia. 
Nancy usará el crédito solicitado para reactivar su negocio el mismo que se trata de la compra y venta de ropa, esperando mejorar su estilo de vida. Agradece a Kiva por ayudarle a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Nancy is an Ecuadorian woman. She was born in the city of Latacunga, province of Cotopaxi. She lives in a rural area of the city, where there is a cool climate. Nancy is 32 years old and happily married to Juan, with whom she has two beautiful children. She sells clothes, which she brings fro the Peruvian border. This activity allows her to have the necessary resources to support her family.

Nancy will use the loan she has asked for to reactivate her business, which is buying and selling clothes, hoping to improve her lifestyle. She is thanks Kiva for helping her make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy clothes and reactivate her business, thus hoping to improve her and her family's lifestyle.

loans.name: León Darío

texts.es:
Darío un hombre con 34 años de edad, casado con y con 2 hijos, trabajando desde hace poco en su casa a la venta de productos alimenticios, con el fin de cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.

El sueño de este hombre es formalizar su negocio y dejárselos a sus hijos.

Solicito un préstamo con el cual abastecerá su negocio comprando verdura y demás enseres que necesite.

Aporta al sueño de este hombre, haz un préstamo.
texts.en: Darío is a 34 year old man who is married, and has 2 children. He has been working from home selling food, with the goal of providing the necessities that his family needs. His dream is to formalize his business and leave it as a legacy to his children. He seeks a loan to buy vegetables and other items he needs to stock his business. Support this man's dreams - make a loan!

loans.use: to buy vegetables and other items he needs.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: En la comunidad donde vive Marcos no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, pero eso no ha impedido que él se desempeñe en sus labores como agricultor y ganadero. Sin embargo  aunque las actividades de Marcos no se han visto afectadas, él y su familia han sufrido por muchos años no tener acceso  a una mejor calidad de  vida que ofrece la energía eléctrica, ya que durante mucho tiempo se han visto en la obligación de comprar lámparas de kerosén, baterías para lámparas, caminar largas distancias para tener acceso a cargar su celular y sobretodo han estado expuestos a los daños a la salud que el kerosén y las velas provocan. Por esto Marcos necesita adquirir un sistema solar, ya que aunque sus hijos ya no están en la escuela, él debe seguir levantándose muy temprano para salir y trabajar y a su esposa se le dificulta la tarea de atenderlo bien por falta de iluminación. Marcos está seguro que el sistema solar le hará un trabajador más productivo, mejorará su vida y la de su familia, ya que no estarán expuestos a gases o humos tóxicos.
texts.en:
There's no access to electricity in the community where Marcos lives, but that hasn't prevented him from doing his job as a farmer and cattle raiser. However, although Marcos' activities haven't been affected he and his family have suffered for many years the lack of access to electricity and the higher standard of living that it provides. For a long time they've been forced to buy kerosene lamps, lamp batteries, and to walk long distances to obtain access to a cell phone charger and above all they've been exposed to the health risks caused by kerosene and candles.

This is why Marcos needs to acquire a solar system, since even though his kids are no longer in school he still must get up early to go out and work and his wife has had a hard time taking care of him because of the lack of lighting. Marcos is certain that a solar system will make him a more productive worker, and improve he and his familiy's life by no longer exposing them to gases and toxic fumes.

loans.use: To purchase a solar system that will improve his standard of living.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel un hombre con 40 años de edad, casado, con un hijo de 5 años, que por necesidad económica monto un sala de internet, por el medio el cual ha logrado salir adelante con su familia.

El sueño de este hombre es comprar una vivienda, y así poder darle a u familia una estabilidad.

Miguel solicito un crédito con el cual compara una CPU y le hará un mantenimiento general a los equipos, lo cual le permitirá generar mas ingresos.

Apoya este sueño, haz un préstamo.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 40-year-old man, who is married and has a 5-year-old son. Out of economic necessity, he started an internet café, through which he has managed to get ahead, along with his family.

This man's dream is to buy a house, in order to give his family stability.

Miguel is requesting a loan with which he will buy a CPU and carry out general maintenance on his machines. This will enable him to generate more income.

Support this dream, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a CPU and carry out general maintenance on his machines

loans.name: Libellee

texts.en:
Libellee is 31 years old. She is married, with two children aged between three and six years. Both of them go to school. 

Libellee sells food stuffs and she has been in a business for the past six years, while her husband is a motorcyclist. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, bananas, and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and renovate her house. 

In the future, Libellee wishes to become a wholeseller.

loans.use: to buy more beans, bananas, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde  6 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, están en una pobreza extrema. Todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Cada una de las integrantes está luchando y pone todo de sí para poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. María, quien es modista, muy buena en lo que hace, confecciona todo tipo de prendas y con ello se gana la vida de una manera muy digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y luchando para poder seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
The group is doing a survey for the elimination of poverty. 6 constituents fall below the poverty line; that is to say they are in extreme poverty. They are all putting their best efforts into growing and getting ahead. 

Each one of the constituents is fighting and doing their best to give a better quality of life to their families. Among them is Mrs. Maria who is a dressmaker and does it very well. She tailors all types of garments and with this she makes a dignified living. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to purchase fabrics, threads, elastics, and other supplies in order to be able to continue with her work and fighting to be able to continue helping her loved ones. She is grateful for the opportunity to be able to continue improving.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, elastic and other supplies.

loans.name: Aurelie

texts.en:
Aurelie is 56 years old. She is married, with three children aged between 20 and 27 years. They all go to school. 

Aurelie sells food stuffs and she is in a business for the past eight years.  

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum, and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sorghum, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es:
Jairo un señor con 58 años de edad, con tres hijos mayores, debido a las condiciones económicas en las que se encuentra desea montar un negocio de comida y así poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

El sueño de Jairo mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Con el préstamo el comprara un carro para preparar comidas y lo surtirá con los productos para este.

Usted puede aportar a este sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
