texts.es: Ana de 35 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace varios años el cual inicio con capital propio, también se dedica a la costura, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, 35 years old, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her two children. She has made a living selling personal products for several years, which she started with her own equity. She also works as a seamstress. Her business is located in her home, and she also travels as a street vendor selling in various areas. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo and deodorants – and therefore be able to continue with her work in order to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, toiletries, seasoning, and candies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a businesswoman from Plaridel. A 63-year-old widow with expertise in selling, she runs a little sari-sari store, earning a small income that supports her family. 

Susan is a full-fledged member of PMPC with several previous loans already; she maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has requested a new loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Susan continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned sardines, corned beef, feed, candies, chips, seasoning, and toiletries.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 33-year-old mother to 2 children, ages 3 and 5. She operates a general store for a living. She is doing her best to earn money to support her two children. Her business is a big help and has sustained the family. She has used her profits to pay school tuition for her children, cover their daily expenses, and buy their food. She started her business four years ago. 

Her business has grown, so she needs more capital to accommodate more customers. She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000  to buy more chips, thread, diapers, matches, canned food, seasoning and toiletries.  In this way, she believes, she will have more profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy chips, thread, diapers, matches, canned food, seasoning and toiletries

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
JAIME TIENE 42 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE, VIVE CON SU CONYUGUE E HIJOS , EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD PEQUEÑA EN LA ZONA URBANA DE CAYALTI DISTRITO QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU.

ÉL SE DEDICA A REALIZAR LABORES AGRICOLAS EN DIFERENTES CAMPOS DE LA ZONA, CON 12 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO, CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS LABORALES Y PERSONALES. SOLICITA PRÉSTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE ANIMALES MENORES PARA SU POSTERIOR COMERCIALIZACION, Y MANTENIMIENTO DE HERRAMIENTAS DE TRABAJO,DE ESTA MANERA OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Jaime is 42 years old, and lives with his spouse and children in a house of their own in a small community in the urban area of the Cayalti district, part of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

His job is doing farm work in different fields in the area, and he has 12 years of experience in this line of work and has good references both personal and work-related. He's applying for a loan to purchase small animals to subsequently sell, and to maintain his work tools. In this way he'll obtain more income and be able to improve he and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase small animals to subsequently sell and to maintain his work tools.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 48 years old and married. She lives in Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. For the past 20 years, Lydia has been a farmer. 

She is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. 

In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба, 41 год, замужем, 2 детей. У нее среднее образование. Махбуба ответственна, жизнерадостна и трудолюбива. Дети активно помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Махбуба в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Махбубы, она смогла добиться высоких результатов в своей деятельности, ее прибыль в месяц составляет в среднем 12,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 20 овец, на 0,15 Га земли выращивает картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Махбуба будет вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и постройку дома.
texts.en: Mahbuba is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She has a secondary education. Mahbuba is responsible, cheerful and hardworking. Her children actively help with the housework. The family is very close-knit, and relations among family members are very good. Mahbuba has 5 years of experience in livestock and started this business with 30,000 som (KGS). It is now the family's primary source of income. Because of Mahbuba's hard work, she has been able to achieve good results. Her monthly income averages 12,000 som (KGS). Her farm has two cows, 20 sheep, and 0.15 hectares of land where she grows potatoes. In order to further develop her business, she turned to the bank Bai -Tushum for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows to fatten and sell. Mahbuba will invest profits from the loan back into her business and into building a house.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en: Juan has worked for various gyms in Texas and trained for 10 years to become a fitness expert. He put his life savings into building his fitness center, Elite Kettlebell Club.  Operating out of Allen, Texas, his fitness club seeks to help seniors get fit. With over 20 years of experience in the field of health, Juan has a mission to inspire small groups over 50 to improve their overall health. After owning his fitness club for three years, he decided it was time to start effectively marketing his business. Juan needs a loan to create flyers, banners, and additional marketing pieces to spread the word about his Elite Kettlebell Club. With his loan, Juan will not only be able to fund the growth of his business, but he’ll be able to bring health and fitness to the seniors who need it the most.  As his business continues to grow, Juan has plans to hire additional staff to support his mission.

loans.use: to pay for marketing and advertising

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned food, insect repellent, diapers, shampoo, seasoning and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, coffee, eggs, corn starch, seasoning, canned food, biscuits and milk, food for family consumption and pay for school fees

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en:
Anunciacion is 62 years old and from Badian, Cebu.  She is married and relies on her poultry business for an income. She raises native chickens in her chicken coop. Native chickens in the Philippines are more expensive in the market compared to broiler type of chicken. It is usually cooked as Chicken Soup locally known as "Tinolang Manok". 

She is asking a loan to buy booster feed. This will help so her chickens will grow healthy and assure her of a better profit. 

In the future, Anunciacion dreams of having a piggery as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy booster feed

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 50-year-old married woman from Moalboal, Cebu. She has five children. The oldest child is 25, while the youngest is 12.

She has a sari-sari (variety/general) store business. She sells items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, sugar, and powdered milk. She usually earns PHP 6,500 a month through sales from the sari-sari store. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy evaporated milk, canned tuna, cooking oil, soy sauce, corned beef, shampoo, conditioner, and bath soap.

Gina would like to expand her business by investing in other products in order to support her family, as well as to save for her children's quality education in the future.

loans.use: to buy evaporated milk, canned tuna, cooking oil, soy sauce, corned beef, shampoo, conditioner, and bath soap.

loans.name: Zindy

texts.en:
Zindy is a 28-year-old general store owner from Badian, Cebu. She sells commodities such as rice, canned goods, sugar, and soap. She has three children, ages 1, 2 and 7, and her partner is a fisherman.

She usually earns 5,000 pesos every month. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more commodities to sell such as rice, sugar, canned goods, candies, chips, biscuits, soy sauce, vinegar, and eggs.

Zindy would like to invest in her business to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods, candies, chips, biscuits, soy sauce, vinegar, and eggs.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 65 years old and married with six children. She lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past 10 years, Anecita has been a farmer. 

Anecita is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soda, canned goods, soap and snack foods

loans.name: Mischel

texts.en: Mischel is 36 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel. She is married. Mischel has a fish vending business, owns a fishing boat business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fish stock. Mischel has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase fish stock.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer Mujeres al Poder se formó hace varios años en una comunidad rural llamada Duacari. Está conformado por 4 socias que se unieron porque creen que es más fácil conseguir financiamiento en éste modo, debido a que ellas no cuentan con garantías para ser acreedoras de un crédito en la banca estatal, por éste motivo manifiestan gratitud a la Fundación por creer en sus proyectos. Todas las socias van a invertir en compra de ganado de engorde. Cuentan con la experiencia para criar éstos animales y tienen todo el espacio físico necesario para mantenerlos, porque viven en parcelas donadas por una institución del gobierno, pero aún no cuentan con la escritura. Leyla es una joven con 25 años, tiene un hijo de 3 años y es madre soltera, vive con su madre en la parcela. Ella se dedica a la cria de ganado, porque tiene la necesidad de cubrir los gastos personales y los de su hijo, debido a que no cuenta con la ayuda del padre de él. En ocasiones trabaja en las piñeras o bananeras que hay en esa zona, la cual es la mayor fuente de ingreso en los hogares. Junto con Leyla hay tres soias más que van a invertir en la misma actividad de ganado. Se organ izan para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
The Mujer Mujeres al Poder [Power to the Women] bank was established several years ago in a rural community called Duacari. It is made up of four members who came together because they thought it would be easier to get financing as a group since they don't have collateral to borrow from a state bank. That is why they express their gratitude to the Foundation for believing in their projects.

All of the members are going to invest in buying beef cattle. They have the experience to raise these animals and they all the physical space they need to care for them because they live on parcels of land that were donated by a government  institution, but they don't have the deed yet. 

Leyla is 25 years old and has a 3-year-old son.  She is a single mom and lives with her mother on the parcel of land. She raises cattle because she needs to cover her personal expenses and those of her son since the child's father does not help them. She occasionally works in the pineapple and banana plantations in the area which is the major source of income for many households.

Together with Leyla there are three more members who are going to invest in the same trade of raising cattle. They have joined together so that they can improve the living conditions for themselves and their families.

loans.use: Compra de ganado

loans.name: Darejani

texts.en:
Darejani is 29 years old, is married and lives in village Kalauri with her husband and 2 children. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grown strawberries. They work hard and sell the harvest at a good price seasonally. Darejani also has hens.
 
She wants to expand her husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and credo enables her to get a loan for husbandry business. With the received credit she will purchase calves, raise and resell them. 

Darejani will build a shed for calves and will purchase feed for them. This will increase the income of family and with increased income Darejani will provide better living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to purchase calves, raise and resell to provide better living conditions for her children

loans.name: Zhamshitbek

texts.ru: Жамшитбек, 55 лет, женат, воспитывает 5 детей. У него среднее образование, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки одной коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Жамшитбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 10 овец. На участке мерою 0,75 Га, он выращивает кукурузу и перец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым покупателям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамшитбек обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для проведения полевых работ. Доходы от кредита Жамшитбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнес деятельности и аренду дополнительных земельных наделов.
texts.en: Zhamshitbek is 55 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a secondary education and works as a farmer. He started his livestock and farming business 30 years ago when he bought a cow. Because of his hard work, Zhamshitbek now has 4 cows and 10 sheep. On his ​​0.75 hectare plot, he grows corn and peppers. His monthly income is 8,000 som (KGS). He sells his harvest to wholesalers. In order to further the development his farm, Zhamshitbek addressed the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer for field work. Zhamshitbek plans to invest profits from the loan into expanding his business and renting more plots of land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer in order to  grow organic produce.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамира, 45 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2000 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Дамира на сегодняшний день имеет 8 коров, 70 овец. Также у нее есть 0,95 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой выращивает экологически-чистые арбузы для реализации. Дамира в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений и клеенки для выращивания экологически-чистых арбузов. Доходы от кредита Дамира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит построить большой сарай для скота.
texts.en: Damira is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary education. As an additional source of income for her family, she has worked in animal husbandry and farming since 2000. Because of her hard work, Damira currently has 8 cows and 70 sheep. She also owns 0.95 hectares of land where she grows organic watermelons. In order to further expand her business, Damira asked the bank "Bai -Tushum" for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds, fertilizer and plastic sheeting to grow organic watermelons. Damira plans to invest profits into further developing her business, which will allow her to build a large shed for cattle.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and plastic in order to  grow organic watermelons.

loans.name: Glenda Liset

texts.es: Glenda de 26 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos un varón de 10 años y dos niñas de 7 y 2 años de edad. Glenda se dedica desde hace  mucho tiempo a la venta de granos básicos y platos típicos actividad que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella desea brindar una mayor protección a sus hijos, es por ello que ha decidido construir un muro de contención en su vivienda el cual proteja la integridad de la misma y de sus hijos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bloque de cemento, arena, grava, hierro y mano de obra para construir un muro de contención  para proteger su vivienda y su familia.
texts.en:
Glenda is 26 years old and is a hard-working woman who lives with her spouse and 3 children, a 10 year old boy and two girls ages 7 and 2. Glenda has been working in the sale of staple foods and traditional dishes for a long time, a job that enables her to put food on her home's table. 

She wants to provide better protection for her children, and that's why she has decided to build a retaining wall for her home. It would protect the home's structural integrity and her children, which is why she's applying for a FUSAI loan to invest in: cement blocks, sand, gravel, iron, and labor to build a retaining wall to protect her home and family.

loans.use: To invest in: cement blocks, sand, gravel, iron, and labor to build a retaining wall to protect her home and family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different type of plants and flowers

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa  lives in Dumanjug, Cebu with her family. She is 32 years old with school-aged children. 

Like most people her age, Ma. Luisa runs a general store and offers manicure and pedicure services. This business is easier to manage because her store is attached to her home. This has been her business for three years now. 

She is asking a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy sugar, milk, coffee, seasoning, spices, canned sardines, corned beef, cooking oil and bath soap. 

Her income will be utilized for the education of her children and food consumption.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, coffee, seasoning, spices, canned sardines, corned beef, cooking oil and bath soap

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a 40-year-old mother of four from Badian, Cebu. She is married, and her husband is a construction worker. Her children are ages six to twelve.  

Cresencia is engaged in food vending, selling a snack called puto, or rice cake.  She usually earn PHP 8,000 per month from her business. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like rice, coconut and sugar. 

Cresencia hope that with the help of the loan she can increase her production, and thus increase her sales. She will manage her business well so she can continue to expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy rice, coconut and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires and pig feed.

loans.name: Babra

texts.en:
Barbra is 28 years old and married with 2 children; both are attending school in Kasese, Uganda. She has a textile shop, works six days a week and earns her side income from a coffee business produce and poultry farming. 

She has requested a loan facility to buy clothes such as dresses, shirts, as well as bed sheets and other items to sell. 

She is hardworking, but faces a challenge of seasonality factors. She has a dream of expanding her business into a well-known shopping centre in his area.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as dresses, shirts, as well as bed sheets and other items to sell

loans.name: Dandja Marie

texts.en: Dandja Marie, 27 years old, is residing at Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married. Recently, she accessed a loan of PHP 20,000 to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items for her existing business in the local community.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Magaly Magdalena

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Justicia Y Libertad.
En este lugar vive la señora Magaly, tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen una  hija de 16 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es estilista. Ella al igual que su marido aprendió belleza en un centro de la ciudad.
Doña Magaly  y su esposo tienen  un salón de belleza en un local que arriendan en el centro de la ciudad, allí ellos realizan diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabello, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas, trabajan todos los días y casi todo el día, ellos allí también venden gel y ciertos tratamientos que ellos utilizan y recomiendan  a sus clientes, llevan más de 13 años con esta actividad la cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar esmaltes, tintes y tratamientos de belleza. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta el trato de la promotora y los beneficios que recibe de la fundación. Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
In the El Florón citadel of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of Tamarinds, the members of the "Justicia Y Libertad" communal bank meet every fortnight.

Magaly lives in this place. She is 43 years old, is in a common-law relationship and from this relationship has a 16 year old daughter who studies in Secondary school. Her husband is a hair stylist. She like her husband also went to study Cosmetology in a center in the city.

Magaly and her husband have a beauty salon in a shop that they lease in the center of the city. They do a variety of work like dying, cutting hair and painting nails amongst others. They work every day almost all day long. They also sell gel and certain treatments that they use and recommend to their clients. They have had this business which allows them to get ahead for 13 years.

They will use this loan to buy nail polish, dyes and beauty treatments. She has been in the communal bank for more than 10 years and she likes the way she gets treated and the benefits that she receives from the foundation. Her dream is to own her own shop.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, dyes and beauty treatments.

loans.name: Rwengwara Tukwatanize Farmers Group

texts.en:
Paskaziya, a member of Rwengwara Tukwatanize Farmers Group, is 53 years old and married with nine children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is farming, though she also rears animals to supplement her income and be able to pay school fees for the three children who are in school. She has a business dream of buying a car to enable her transport her products to the market without inconvenience, despite the challenge of unpredictable weather changes.

Paskaziya is requesting a loan to pay for labour to prepare her garden for planting.

loans.use: to pay for labour to prepare her garden for planting.

loans.name: Urgul

texts.ru: Ургул, 57 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Ургул занимается животноводством и полеводством. Имеет развитое хозяйство, а именно 22 овцы, 4 коровы. На 1,60 Га земли она выращивает картофель, кукурузу, клевер для реализации. Ургул получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 17,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и перепродажи. Ургул является лидером группы "Айпери", в которой всего состоят 3 человека. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также она мечтает приобрести автомобиль.
texts.en: Urgul is 57 years old, married and has 5 children. To provide income for her family, Urgul farms and keeps livestock. She has developed her farm so that now it has 22 sheep and four cows. On 1.60 hectares of land she grows potatoes, corn, and clover for feed. Urgul earns a monthly income of about 17,000 som (KGS). She asked to the bank "Bai - Tushum" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves to fatten and sell. Urgul is the leader of the group "Ayperi" which consists of 3 people. She plans to invest her profits into further expanding her farm, and she wants to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy some calves to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Ariypa

texts.ru: Арийпа, 58 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, Арийпа занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве имеет 30 овец, 4 коровы. На 0,50 Га арендованной земли она выращивает клевер для реализации. Арийпа получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 6,300 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка для откорма и перепродажи. Арийпа является участником группы "Айпери", в которой всего состоят 3 человека. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также она планирует сделать ремонт.
texts.en: Ariypa is 58 years old, married and has 4 children. To provide an income for her family, Ariypa works in farming and livestock. The farm has 30 sheep, four cows. She leases 0.50 hectares land where she grows clover for feed. Ariypa earns a monthly income of about 6,300 som (KGS). She appealed to the bank "Bai - Tushum" for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to purchase a calf to fatten and sell. Ariypa is a member of the group "Ayperi" which consists of 3 people. She plans to invest profits into expanding her farm and making necessary repairs.

loans.use: buy a calf to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Tukonyerangane Bulindi Group

texts.en:
Plaxeda is a member of Tukonyerangane Bulindi Group. She operates a retail shop, mainly selling general merchandise, salt, sugar and soap. 

In order to supplement her income, she carries out farming, mainly cassava and beans. 

She intends to expand her business and grow more, but she is limited by inadequate capital. 

She will use the loan facility to buy more stock like salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro lives in Dili. His son has completed university studies and is now awaiting graduation. Pedro hasn't enough money to bear all the expenses for the graduation ceremony. Pedro is requesting from Tuba Rai Metin a loan of $1,000. The money is intended to be used to cover all expenses related to the ceremony.

loans.use: to pay for expenses related to his son's graduation ceremony.

loans.name: Aiperi

texts.ru: Айпери 21 год, она замужем, есть годовалый сын. По характеру она оптимистичная, ответственная, спокойная. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Айпери занимается животноводством. Имеет развитое хозяйство, а именно 40 овец, 5 коров, 3 теленка. Айпери получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 20,500 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и перепродажи. Айпери является участником группы "Айпери", в которой всего состоят 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Акинай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также она мечтает отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Aiperi is 21 years old, married, and has a one-year-old son. By nature, she is optimistic, responsible, calm. To earn an income for the family, Aiperi  works in animal husbandry. Her farm has 40 sheep, 5 cows, and 3 calves. Aiperi receives a monthly income of about 20,500 som (KGS). She appealed to the bank "Bai - Tushum" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves to fatten and sell. Aiperi is a member of the group "Ayperi" which consists of 3 people. Aiperi plans to use profits to expand her farm and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy some calves to fatten and sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 27 year old married woman with three children. She lives in a rural community on the island of Guadalcanal in the Solomon Islands.

She raises and sells chickens in her community or at the market to earn a living. She been doing this for three years.

Caroline needs a loan to buy new chicks and chicken feed to help her in the business. She plans to use her profits to improve her poultry shed and help cover her family's weekly expenses.

She has been an SPBD member since 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy 150 day-old chicks and chicken feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita's business is retailing vegetables. Her capital is not adequate to run a big business, which why she is now requesting a loan of $800 to buy more vegetables and other consumables such as beans, cooking oil, dry fish and others. 

Anita is married and lives in Dili. She has been selling vegetables since 2008, when she started with capital of $500.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and resell them

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina started her kiosk business in 2007 with her own capital of $500. She wants to make her kiosk bigger, which requires more capital. To address her need, she is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin.

She will use the money to buy more goods such as sugar, cooking oil, ketchup and other items. She is lives in Dili.

loans.use: To buy more goods such sugar, candy, ketchup, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира, 35 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. У нее высшее образование, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи в 1998 году начала свой бизнес в полеводстве и животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади. На арендованном участке 1,0 Га она выращивает ячмень. Назира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма на пастбище и  перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, что позволит ей накопить на покупку юрты для проживания летом на пастбище.
texts.en: Nazira is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four children of school and pre-school age. She has a university degree. While searching for a source of income for her family, she began farming and working with livestock in 1998. Because of her hard work,  Nazira now has two cows, 10 sheep, and 2 horses. On plot of 1.0 hectares that she rents, she grows barley. Nazira asked the bank "Bai -Tushum" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase two steers for fattening. Nazira plans to invest her profits into expanding the farm, enabling her to save up to buy a yurt so that she can live in the pasture during the summer.

loans.use: to buy two steers to fatten and sell in order to save money to buy a new yurt.

loans.name: Mercedes Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Justicia Y Libertad.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene  66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen nueve hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Mercedes junto a su familia tienen un local que arriendan en el centro de la ciudad, allí ellos desde muy de mañana preparan y venden deliciosos encebollados y ceviches de pescado,  trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su marido y dos hijos que también se ganan su sustento diario gracias a este negocio, todo lo que ellos preparan se termina muy rápido  y hay días que antes del medio día ya no tienen nada y tienen que preparar mas para brindar a los clientes este delicioso plato, ellos tienen mucha clientela que han logrado brindando el mejor servicio durante 10 años que llevan con esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado,  yuca, sodas y otros víveres más para preparar los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un local propio y más grande.
texts.en: In the citadel of El Florón of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, is where the members of the Credit Group "Justicia y Libertad" (Justice and Liberty) meet up every two weeks. Mercedes lives here. She is 66 years old, married, and has nine children who are adults and independent. Her husband is a merchant. Mercedes and her family rent a place in the downtown area of the city. There they prepare and sell delicious onion dishes and fish "ceviche" from very early in the morning . She works every day with the help of her husband and two children, who also earn their daily subsistence thanks to this business. Everything they prepare gets sold very quickly, and there are days when, already at noon, they do not have anything left and they need to prepare more in order to offer their customers this delicious dish. They have many customers they have acquired by offering the best service during the 10 years they already do this job. This loan is to buy fish, cassava, sodas and other food items to prepare the food. She has been in the Credit Group since the beginning, and she likes it because with the loans she is able to move forward. Her dreams are to have her own bigger place.

loans.use: to buy fish, cassava, sodas and other food items.

loans.name: Clemencia Angela

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Justicia Y Libertad.
En este lugar vive la señora Clemencia, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, una de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es electricista.
Doña Clemencia es una mujer que le encanta trabajar para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene un bazar en su casa donde vende ropa de todo tipo, carteras, perfumes, cosas para regalos entre otros artículos de bazar, ella también allí mismo elabora figuras hechas en fomix y espumaflex con diversos motivos como carameleras y adornos para fiestas infantiles, estos los elabora bajo pedidos o para la venta al público en su mismo bazar. Tiene más de 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual  se gana algo por el bien familiar.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes y materiales para elaborar manualidades. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a bajos intereses. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su negocio y su vida.
texts.en:
In the town of El Florón, city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarindos, the members of the group Crédito Justicia Y Libertad (Justice and Freedom Loan) get together every fifteen days.
Clemencia lives there. She is 60 years old, she is married and she has four children of age. One of them still lives with her. Her husband is an electritian.
Clemencia is a woman who loves to work to help her husband with the household expenses. She runs a store out of her home where she sells all knds of clothes, purses, perfumes, gift items and others. She also sells items made out of fomix and foamflex with different shapes, such as candy boxes, ornaments for kids parties. She makes these to order or to sell out of her store. She's been in the business for more than 5 years, which allows her to make some money to help her family.
She will use this loan to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes and materials to make crafts. She's been a member if this group for three years and she likes it because the loans are quick and with low interest rates. Her dream is to continue improving her business and her life.

loans.use: buy clothes, shoes, perfumes and materials to make crafts.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey used the previous loan to buy building materials like iron sheets, timber and doors. He is a motorcyclist and at the same time does farming that adds more income for him. 

He is faced with challenges of limited capital that hinders expansion of his business. However, he is working very hard to make sure he constructs rentals that will add more income to him. 

Godfrey has asked for a loan to plaster his rentals.

loans.use: to plaster his rentals.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 41-year-old married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She tailors textiles and clothes to sell. She started the business to cater for the family needs, being a hardworking parent. She desires to educate her children, though inadequate capital affects her business.

Winnie will use the loan to buy clothing material for tailoring.

loans.use: to buy clothing material for tailoring.

loans.name: Kicuucu Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Jovia, aged 54, is a hardworking mother of 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop in addition to farming to earn income. The need to/ develop herself and look after her family forced her to engage in business. Her business desire is to trade in wholesale despite the challenges of competition and price fluctuations of retail products. 

She requests a loan to buy cooking oil, sodas and rice among other things to sell.

She is a member of Kicuucu Tweyimukye Group where members guarantee one another to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sodas and rice among other things to sell.

loans.name: Scholarstica

texts.en:
Scholarstica is 42 years old and lives in Lilongwe District. She is married, and the couple are both primary school teachers by profession. Together they have three children. The first and the second born attend secondary school and the last born is in primary school. The combined amount of their salaries combined is close to 288 USD, which is not enough to sustain the entire household. Hence, she needs capital to enable her venture into a pig enterprise. 

As a teacher who teaches agriculture, Scholarstica says it is high time to start giving lessons out of real experience by first becoming a livestock farmer specialized in pigs. As an optimist, Scholarstica believes the loan will change her life and those around her home by giving her an alternative source of income, which in turn will help improve her family’s standard of living. After successfully repaying the loan, she wants to save part of the returns towards her children’s tertiary education.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid pigs, start-up feed, cement for pigsty construction and receive training in pig production.

loans.name: Benkadi-Yiriwaton Group

texts.fr:
Souleymane est le Monsieur  qui  tient la corne du bélier sur la photo au milieu.
Souleymane est  un  malien  non scolarisé. Il est âgé de 46 ans, marié Père de 08 enfants, âgés de 6ans à  20 ans dont 1 est  scolarisé. Sa femme est une ménagère. 
 Souleymane  fait  l’élevage des béliers et le commerce de produits agricole.
 Il prend le prêt avec le RMCR pour acheter  beaucoup  de béliers et de produits agricole. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend   en ville.   Il  a une expérience de 18 ans  d’activité.
 Avec le profit, Souleymane  pourra subvenir à certains besoins de sa famille (habillement, santé et frais de scolarité).  Il est souvent confronté à certains cas de maladies mais s’organise de manière à  avoir  un vétérinaire pour  apporte  des soins. 
Son rêve est de  construire une bonne maison  pour sa  famille.
texts.en:
Souleymane is the gentleman in the middle holding the ram’s horn. He is an uneducated Malian, 46 years old, and the married father of eight children, from 6 to 20 years old, of whom one is in school. His wife is a homemaker. 

Souleymane raises rams and does commerce in farm products. He is taking out a loan from RMCR to purchase many rams and a lot of farm products. His supplies come from nearby fairs, and he resells in town. He has eighteen years of experience. 

With the profits, Souleymane will be able to meet certain needs of his family (clothing, healthcare, and school fees). He is often confronted with certain instances of diseases but is prepared, so that a veterinarian provides care. Souleymane’s dream is to build a good house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and farm products to resell

loans.name: Kunduzkan

texts.ru: Кундузкан, 51 год, вдова, мать 2 дочерей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Кундузкан на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы. Также у нее есть 0,37 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой она выращивает картофель. Ее ежемесячный доход - 7,400 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. Кундузкан в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Кундузкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Kunduzkan is 51 years old, a widow, and has two daughters. She has a secondary education. To earn an income for her family she works in farming and animal husbandry. Because of her hard work, Kunduzkan currently has 2 cows. She also has 0.37 hectares of her own land where she grows potatoes. Her monthly income is 7,400 som (KGS). This income is not enough for a decent life. Kunduzkan, in order to further grow her business, contacted the bank "Bai -Tushum" for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows to fatten and sell. Kunduzkan plans to invest profits in further expanding her business which will improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: buy a cow to fatten and sell.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
En El sitio Santa Martha de la  parroquia Rio chico en Portoviejo, cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito querer es poder de Rio chico. Este lugar se lo conoce por su  vegetación donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.
Aquí vive la señora María, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera  de tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad. 
Doña María es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola,  ella tiene  un taller de costura en su casa donde se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros o niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Lleva más de 12 años dedicada  a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias  a los créditos ella sale adelante, ella agradece mucho a las personas que le ayudan con estos créditos. Sus sueños son que nunca le falte salud y trabajo para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
At Santa Martha of the Rio Chico parish in Portoviejo, the members of the Rio Chico loan group "Querer es Poder" (Where There's a Will, There's a Way) meet every two weeks. This place is known for its vegetation. The majority of its inhabitants make a living in agriculture. 

There lives María. She is 49 years old and the single mother of three adult children, one of whom still lives with her. A few years ago, she learned sewing and dressmaking in a local academy. María is a woman who has had to work very hard to help her daughters get ahead all on her own. She has a sewing shop in her home where she produces all kinds of clothing for women, men, and children. She works on orders that customers place and, seasonally, she makes uniforms for local institutions, elementary schools, and high schools. She has been working in this trade for more than 12 years, earning a living. 

María will use this loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials. She has been part of this loan group for five years and she likes it because the loans help her move forward. María is very grateful to the people who help her through these loans. Her dreams are to never lack health and work so that she can keep getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, soda, snack food, soap, toiletries, and other household essentials.

loans.name: Palinji Group

texts.en:
Married with 5 dependents, Margret, aged 60, owns a grocery which she depends on for the provision of the family’s needs and her children's education. 

Intending to improve her family’s welfare, Margret will use the loan to buy more commodities for her grocery in order to increase her profits. 

She plans of buying a plot of land for her children. 

The loans have helped her to become more independent than she was before.

loans.use: to buy snacks

loans.name: Andy

texts.en:
Andy is 22 years old and married with three children. She lives in a rural community within Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

Andy owns and operates a small general store selling food items such as rice, biscuits, noodles, snacks and other household items. She has been doing this for two years.

She needs a loan buy goods to restock her small general store. She hope to meet her family's weekly expenses and also improve her business with the profits she makes from her general store.

She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bale of rice, bale of sugar, bale of salt, canned food and snacks for her general store.

loans.name: Tiago

texts.en: Tiago lives in Dili. His house has half of its wall made of cement and the rest made of local and not resistant wood material. He is requesting a loan of $1,500.00 that he will use to buy materials such as cement and sand, to complete the wall of his house. He head about Tuba Rai Metin, and now considers taking this loan to help him make his dream a reality: to live in a decent house where the wall is made of concrete blocks.

loans.use: to buy cement to complete the wall of his house.

loans.name: Gulbaira

texts.ru: Гулбайра, 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Гулбайры - среднее образование, она ответственная, хозяйственная, честная. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулбайра занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулбайры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 15 овец, 3 лошади, продает молоко. На 2,25 Га земли она выращивает пшеницу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,300 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулбайра обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически чистого домашнего молока. Доходы от кредита Гулбайра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку дома.
texts.en: Gulbaira is 48 years old, married, and with her husband, is raising three children. Gulbaira has a secondary education; she is responsible, thrifty, honest. Gulbaira's work provides the primary income for the family. She started 18 years ago when she bough 10,000 som (KGS) worth of cattle. Because of her hard work, Gulbaira's farm now has 6 cows (she sells the milk), 15 sheep, 3 horses, and 2.25 hectares of land where she grows wheat. Her monthly income is 17,300 som (KGS). In order to furtherexpand her farm, Gulbaira asked the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy dairy cows to increase the production of organic milk. Gulbaira plans to invest profits into buying more domestic animals, and she plans to save money to build a house.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk sales.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BITON MAMARY est le monsieur qui a la corde du bœuf à la main sur la photo.
BITON MAMARY est un emboucheur malien âgé de 30 ans scolarisé, Il est marié père de 06 enfants, 04 garçons et 02 filles. Les enfants sont âgés de 7 à 13 ans et fréquentent tous l’école. 
Sa femme est ménagère. BITON MAMARY fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir bien mener son activité, il fait l’embouche des bovins. Il mène cette activité depuis longtemps. Cette activité lui plait beaucoup grâce à son avantage. Il s’approvisionne sur le marché de la localité et revend dans le même marché.  Le profit lui permettra de prendre en charges certaines dépenses de sa famille. 
Il rencontre souvent des problèmes de mévente sur le marché. 
Dans l’avenir, BITON MAMARY veut avoir un prêt plus élevé pour pouvoir  augmenter le volume de son activité afin de tirer beaucoup de profit.
texts.en:
BITON MAMARY is the gentleman holding the cattle’s rope in the photo. He is a Malian livestock farmer, 30 years old, educated, and the father of six children (4 boys and 2 girls). The children are aged 7 to 13, all attending school. His wife is a homemakers. 

BITON MAMARY has turned to RMCR to carry out his work fattening cattle. He has been in this business for a long time, and he is very happy with it, thanks to his advantage. He gets his supplies from the town market, and he resells at the same market. The profit will enable him to cover certain family expenses. 

He often encounters problems with low sales. For the future, BITON MAMARY wants to have a bigger loan to be able to increase his business volume, so as to make a lot of profit.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell later on

loans.name: Alejandra Guadalupe

texts.es: Alejandra de 18 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella siempre busca la manera de sacar adelante a su hijo y para ello se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir desde hace un año gracias a su amabilidad y sencillez Alejandra ha logrado atraer una gran cantidad de clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Para brindar una mayor protección a su hijo Alejandra ha decidido construir un  muro de protección y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bloque de cemento, arena, grava, cemento y hierro para construir un muro de protección en la orilla de su vivienda.
texts.en: Alejandra is 18 years old and lives in a home of her own with her little 3 year old son. She always is looking for a way to get her son ahead and to that end she has been selling garments for a year. Thanks to her friendliness and humility Alejandra has managed to attract a big number of customers that become more loyal every day. To provide her son with more protection Alejandra has decided to build a retaining wall and for that reason is applying for a FUSAI loan to invest in: cement blocks, sand, gravel, cement, and iron to build a retaining wall on the edge of her home.

loans.use: To invest in: cement blocks, sand, gravel, cement and iron to build a retaining wall on the edge of her house.

loans.name: Lourdes Monserrate

texts.es:
En El sitio Santa Martha de la  parroquia Rio chico en Portoviejo, cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito querer es poder de Rio chico. Este lugar se lo conoce por su vegetación donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.
En este lugar vive la señora Lourdes, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de  22, 19 y 15 años, el menor estudia en colegio, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es agricultor. 
Doña Lourdes es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para  ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon, (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale dos o tres veces por semana a vender y cobrar sus productos ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, ella también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando desean algún producto de los que ella vende, lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad la cual le permite ganar lo suyo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otras cosas. Lleva más de 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
In Santa Martha of the Rio chico parish, in Portoviejo, the members of the loan group "Querer es Poder" (Where there's a will, there's a way) meet every two weeks. This place is known for its vegetation and the majority of its residents make a living working in agriculture. 

Here lives Lourdes. She is 44 years old and in a common-law marriage, from which she has three children ages 22, 19, and 15. Two of her children live with her and the youngest is a high school student. Lourdes' husband is a farmer. 

Lourdes is a woman who likes to work to help her husband with the household expenses. She makes a living in business, selling clothing of all kinds as well as Avon products (beauty products, perfume, and women's accessories.) She sells her products door to door. She goes out two or three times a week to sell and collect payment for her products since she offers them on credit with weekly payments. She also sells items from her home, to which customers come when they desire some of her products. Lourdes has been working like this for more than 10 years. It allows her to earn her own money. 

This loan is to buy clothing, perfume, creams, cosmetics, and other items. She has been a member of the loan group for more than five years. She likes it because of the help that the loans give her. Lourdes' dreams are to keep moving forward in her business and family life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Justicia Y Libertad.
En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen diez hijos mayores de edad, una de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es agricultor y albañil.
Doña Flor es una mujer que le encanta trabajar para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que el no gana mucho por su avanzada edad, ella se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, manteles, zapatillas por catalogo entre otros productos, ella también compra telas y otros materiales de costura y confecciona sabanas las mismas que vende al mismo tiempo que la otra mercadería, deja  a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 30  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual  se gana algo por el bien familiar.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes y telas para elaborar las sabanas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a bajos intereses. Sus sueños es tener salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
In the town of El Florón, city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarindos, the members of the group Crédito Justicia Y Libertad (Justice and Freedom Loan) get together every fifteen days.
Flor lives there. She is 61 years old, she is married has 10 children of age. One of her daugthers still lives with her. Her husband is a farmer and a construction worker.
Flor is a woman who loves to work to help her husband with the household expenses, he doesn't make a lot of money due to his age, so she works as a sales person. She sells all kinds of clothes, table clothes, shoes by catalog among other items. She also buys fabric and other materials to tailor and sew bed sheets to sell alongside her different items. People buy on credit and she collects every eight days. She's been in the business for more than 30 years which helps her make some money to help her family.
She will use this loan to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes and fabric to make bedsheets. She's been a member if this group since its beginning and she likes it because the loans are quick and with low interest rates. Her dream is to be healthy and have healthy children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes and fabric.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Siaka est le monsieur qui  tient la corde du bélier sur la photo.
Siaka est  un  malien  non scolarisé âgé de 41 ans, marié et  Père de 05 enfants, âgés de  2 ans à   15 ans dont 2 sont scolarisés. Sa femme est une ménagère.
 Siaka fait  l’élevage des béliers, Il prend le prêt avec le RMCR pour acheter  beaucoup  de béliers. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend  ses béliers  en ville.  Il  a une expérience de 15  ans  d’activité.
 Avec  le profit,  Siaka pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (habillement, santé et frais de scolarité).  Il est souvent confronté à certaines difficultés (mort) et  aux  coûts  chers  des frais de transport des béliers  mais organise généralement  le voyage avec des éleveurs  de sa localité pour  relever les défis.
Dans l’avenir  Siaka veut  un prêt beaucoup plus  élevé pour développer son  activité  d’élevage pour gagner plus de profit afin de se construire une maison en tôle  pour sa  famille.
texts.en:
Siaka is the gentleman holding the ram’s rope in the photo. He is an uneducated Malian, 41 years old, and the father of five children, from 2 to 15 years old, of whom two are in school. His wife is a homemakers. 

Siaka raises rams. He is taking out a loan with RMCR to purchase many rams. He gets his supplies from nearby fairs and resells his rams in town. He has fifteen years of experience.

With the profits, he will be able to support his family (clothing, healthcare, school fees). He is often confronted with certain difficulties (death) and the high costs of transporting rams, but he generally organizes trips with livestock farmers from his town to meet the challenges. 

For the future, Siaka wants a much bigger loan to develop his business raising livestock in order to earn more profit, so as to build a house with a sheet metal roof for his family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to sell later on

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru: Ирина, 63 года, вдова, мама 2 детей. У нее высшее образование. Ирина работает в Государственном Университете ведущим концертмейстером, также получает пенсию. Суммарно ее чистый доход - около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Ирина  обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка штукатурки, краски и прочих строительных материалов для ремонта дома и погреба. Свои доходы Ирина планирует вложить в дальнейший ремонт дома.
texts.en: Irina is 63 years old, a widow, and the mother of 2 children. She has a college degree. Irina works at the State University as concertmaster. She also receives a pension. Her income is about 8,000 som (KGS) per month. Irina turned to the bank "Bai -Tushum" for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS), to buy plaster, paint and other construction materials to repair her house and cellar. Irina plans to invest the loan into further renovating her house.

loans.use: buy plaster, paints etc. to make some improvements in her house and cellar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, soft drinks, baked goods, bulk items, and more.

loans.name: Cesiri Group

texts.fr:
AWA, est la dame  qui a sa  main dans  le sac  d’arachide  sur la photo.
 AWA est une  malienne, âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants  donc un  scolarisé. Son mari est un cultivateur et fait l’élevage.
Elle fait le commerce  du riz et d’arachide  depuis 04 ans. AWA  s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants  et revend ses marchandises dans les mêmes marchés. Le profit qu’elle réalise la permet d’aider son mari pour subvenir à certains besoins des enfants.
Elle emprunte de l’argent auprès du  RMCR pour financer et accroitre son activité au moment propice. 
AWA est souvent confronté au problème de mévente sur le marché s’y débrouille beaucoup, AWA  souhaite  devenir une grande commençante  de céréale dans  le  futur et avoir un prêt plus élevé pour développer son activité.
texts.en:
AWA is the lady with her hand inside the sack of peanuts in the photo. She is Malian, 40 years old, and the married mother of four children, of whom one is in school. Her husband is a farmer and raises livestock. She has been doing commerce in rice and peanuts for four years. She gets her supplies from the nearby markets and resells her merchandise at the same markets. The profit she makes enables her to help out her husband in meeting certain needs of the children. She is borrowing some money from RMCR to finance her business and grow it at the right time.

AWA is often confronted with the problem of low sales. [She does a lot to resolve it.] Her wish is to become a major merchant of grains in the future and to have a much bigger loan for developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of grain to resell

loans.name: Grecia Mercedes Judith

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo de Crédito Justicia Y Libertad.
En este lugar vive la señora Grecia, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa y estudian en universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Grecia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante junto  a su familia, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como granos, detergentes, carnes, legumbres, entre productos de primera necesidad, así como también artículos de bazar y licores entre otros productos, trabaja todos los días  y en ocasiones  sus  hijos y su marido  le ayudan pero es ella es la que siempre está atenta a las necesidades de sus clientes, lleva más de 5 años con este negocio el cual lo comenzó con los créditos que recibió del grupo, razón por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres y artículos de bazar. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of El Florón, city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarindos, the members of the group Crédito Justicia Y Libertad (Justice and Freedom Loan) get together every fifteen days.
Grecia lives there. She is 51 years old, she is married and she has four children of age. Three of them still live with her. Her husband is a businessman.
Grecia is a woman who loves to work to take care of her family. She runs a bazaar out of her home and she also sells liqueurs among others. She works every day and her husband and children help her from time to time, although she is the one taking care of her customers. She's been in the business for more than 5 years, which she started using the loans that she received from this group, and she is very thankful for that.
She will use this loan to buy provisions and bazaar items. She's been a member if this group for ten years and she likes it because she was able to start her business with them. Her dream is to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy provisions and bazaar items.

loans.name: Joyeuse Group

texts.fr: Mahamba est commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire «Joyeuse», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 48 ans, femme vivant seule. Elle est vendeuse de divers pagnes dans un  marché de la place depuis 15 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son frère. Elle va acheter 30 pièces de pagnes. Elle  souhaite accroitre son capital et construire une maison. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Mahamba is a merchant and the president of the community bank “Joyeuse”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 48-year-old woman living by herself. She has been a vendor of different 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) at a local market for fifteen years. She began her business with funds from her brother. She is going to purchase 30 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth. Her wish is grow her capital and build a house. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 30 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: Maliyasasa est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Etoile», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 61 ans, mère 2 enfants qui n’étudient pas. Elle est vendeuse des pains dans une mini boulangerie à son domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 20 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 7sacs de farine de fromant, etc. Elle souhaite construire une maison et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables
texts.en: Maliyasasa is a merchant and a member of the 'banc villageois' called “Etoile”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 61 years old and the married mother of two children, who are not in school. She has been a vendor of breads at a mini-bakery in her home on a busy avenue in town, for twenty years. She is going to stock up with 7 sacks of wheat flour, etc. Her wish is to build a house and provide food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with 7 sacks of wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Jeofrey

texts.en: Jeofrey used the previous loan to pay for labour and plant more bananas. He has a retail shop dealing in general merchandise, plus he farms and sells bananas. The challenge Jeofrey faces is limited capital that hinders expansion of his business. However, he is looking forward to expanding his business and becoming self sustainable. He has asked for a loan to buy stocks of sugar, posho (a hot, sticky dough), soap, cooking oil and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, posho, soap, cooking oil and beans to sell.

loans.name: Jhon Fredy

texts.es:
Jhon de 27 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. 

Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. 

Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, esta mujer inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para abastecer su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jhon, 27 years old, has gained the care of all of his neighbors because of his friendliness and good sense of humor. He loves his family, which is the main reason for fighting each day and generating sustenance in order to survive.

Although he didn't have resources to start his business, this wasn't an impediment in order to achieve his dream of becoming a merchant. With a little capital, this man started with a grocery store business.

His dreams don't stop. For this reason, he is found applying for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of an assortment of staple family products to improve his sales.

He hopes to be able to improve his economic condition, be able to have an old age without monetary worries and guarantee a better future for his family.

loans.use: to stock his business with an assortment of staple family products to improve his sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens and supplies.

loans.name: Obed

texts.en: Obed is a very hardworking man aged 29, married with two children, one of whom attends school, in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in produce mainly buying and selling maize and beans among other items. He gets additional income from growing beans and cassava. He dreams of expanding and growing his business more. Obed is seeking a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Fidélité Group

texts.fr: Batumike est commerçante, trésorière de la banque communautaire «Fidélité», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 22 ans, mariée, mère d’un enfant qui est gosse. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari, lui qui est aussi commerçant. Elle va acheter un ballon de souliers. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital et nourrir son enfant. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Batumike is a merchant and the treasurer of the community bank “Fidélité”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 22 years old and the married mother of a very young child. 

She has been a vendor of used shoes at a market in town for four years. She began her business with funds from her husband, who is also a merchant. She is going to purchase a bale of shoes. Her wish is to increase her capital and provide food for her child. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of shoes

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is aged 22, a single mother of one child aged 5 five years, and she lives in Hoima, Uganda. She ventured into selling soft drinks, like juice and sodas, along side the selling of groceries. She also likes farming, mainly growing cassava and beans. Brenda hopes to grow and expand her business. She is seeking a loan to buy more sodas and juice to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sodas and juice to sell.

loans.name: Fatima Group

texts.en: Emmie, aged 39, has five children and only two go to school.  She grows and sells vegetables to people in her community. She started this business in order to support her family and to send her children to school. Emmie will use the loan to expand her business. Her main intention is to send her children to better schools and to build them a good house. The loans have helped her to be economically empowered, as she is now able to provide basic needs to her children with little challenges.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo está integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ellas luchadoras y emprendedoras que se unieron con el objetivo de crecer y mejorar, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el cual quieren ir superándose cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lorenza, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir, en un nivel de pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, y de toda marca, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar e ir superándose cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas de todo tipo, como ser camisas, blusas, pantalones, remeras y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group is formed by 17 determined and enterprising women who got together with the goal to grow and improve. They are within the elimination of poverty program, with which they want to better themselves each day.

One of the members is Lorenza who in her survey showed a poverty level within level one, that is to say, in a level of extreme poverty. She works selling all kinds of clothing, and of all brands. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person who puts forth all of herself to be able to improve and better herself each day.

She requests this loan to be able to buy clothing of all types, such as shirts, blouses, pants, t-shirts, and other items, and in this way be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, t-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso tiene 32 años de edad, soltero , sin hijos a su cargo , vive en casa familiar; en el distrito Cayalti, la cual es una zona rural, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, Costa norte de Perú.

Alfonso se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería; hace 15 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; arreglos de su vivienda compra de calamina, puertas, y herramientas de trabajo esto con la finalidad de brindar mejores servicio a sus clientes y generar mayores ingreso que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 32 years old, single, without children in his care. He lives in a family house, in Cayalti district, which is a rural zone, which belongs to Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru.

Alfonso works providing the service of a day laborer: 15 years ago, this business was found located in his home. He is applying for a loan to invest in fixed assets: repairs to his come - purchase of corrugated iron, doors, and work tools, this with the goal of providing better services to his customers and to generate more income which will permit him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his home and for work tools.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Это Нодира. Ей 40 лет. Она жительница района Чиликул. Нодира семейная женщина. Она домохозяйка, но времени не проводят по пустоту. Нодира сидя дома занимается маленьким бизнесом. Она берет заказы на шитье женской одежды. У нее больше опыта в этой сфере деятельностью. Нодире научила кроить и шить ее мама. Благодаря ее маме, у Нодире сейчас имеет собственный источник доход. Это машинка, которая снята на фотке, это мамина машинка. Мамина машинка уже устарела, и Нодире нужно современная электрическая машинка, чтобы ускорить процесс работы и привлечь больше клиентов. Такими планами Нодира обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется, что сможет приобрести желаемую швейную машинку.
texts.en: This is Nadira. She is 40 years old. She lives in Jilikul. Nadira is a married woman. She is a housewife, but she's not idle. Nadira works from home. She takes orders to sew women's clothes. She has experience in this field. Nadira's mother taught her to sew. Because of her mother, Nadira has her own income. Her machine, which can be seen in the pictures, is her mother's machine. Her mother's machine is outdated and Nadira needs a modern electric machine to speed up her work and attract more customers. Nadira asks for a loan to fulfill her plans of buying a new sewing machine.

loans.use: buy a modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy women's clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Kyarumba Thuyihimbe Group

texts.en: Nason is a male who is 47 years old and married with 5 children who all attend school. He is a member of Kyarumba Thuyihimbe group. He has been selling drinks since 2003 and is faced with the challenges of market competition and price variations. He earns an additional income from a coffee business. He is a hard-working man and hopes to get profits which will expand his business. He is requesting a loan to buy beer and spirits for selling.

loans.use: to buy beer and spirits for selling.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a male, aged 40, who is married with 8 children, all of whom are attending school in Kasese-Uganda. He has owned a retail shop of general merchandise since 2013. He gets additional income from farming, which has enabled him to sustain his family. He is faced with the challenge of limited income. He started his business so as to sustain himself and the family at large. He describes himself as hard-working and he has hopes of educating his children and building a residential house. He will use the loan to buy house construction materials like bricks, iron bars and other materials.

loans.use: to buy house construction materials like bricks, iron bars and other materials.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 25 years old and married with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. Isaac sells crude salt and earns his side income from salt pans and motorcycle transport. He has been in this business for six years and has hopes of having a better life in future, educating his children and being rich. However, he is faced with the challenge of poor climatic conditions like heavy rainfall, which limits his salt business. He is a hard-working man who needs a loan to buy crude salt.

loans.use: to buy crude salt.

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans, Aku est une femme mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Aku habite à Baguida et vend des pates dentifrices et des cures dent en se promenant dans les quartiers. Aku s’approvisionne trois fois dans le mois au marché. Aku souhaite répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité et  demande ce crédit pour commander des pates dentifrices. Aku désire avoir une marge de bénéfice pour couvrir les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Aku, aged 45, is a married woman and the mother of five. She lives in Baguida and sells toothpaste and teeth cleaners by going from district to district. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market. Her wish is to respond favorably to the expectations of her customers, who are happy with her business. Aku is asking for this loan to order some toothpaste. She would like to have a profit margin for covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 24 of toothpastes

loans.name: Chingawe Group

texts.en:
Joyce is aged 38 and has four children in her custody. She used to be a farmer and obtaining loans helped her to start up a new business. She owns a grocery in her community that she depends on for her daily needs and for the provision of her children’s welfare. She started this business in order to be economically empowered and independent.
Joyce will use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more commodities for her shop; this will help her to increase her profits. She has plans of hiring someone to help her in running her business and hopes to build a better house. The loans have helped her to become independent and Joyce is now able to provide basic needs for her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, bread and biscuits.

loans.name: Jeovani Ricardo

texts.es:
