texts.en: Kennedy is hardworking man who does cattle fattening. He also has a taxi for transport business as an additional income. He hopes to educate his children through university level and buy land for his family. Kennedy is challenged by prolonged droughts and seasonal weather changes as he lacks enough water and pasture for his animals. He is requesting a loan to buy more cows for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 3 children and all go to school. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 3 year. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenge includes seasonality of green bananas. Her goal and aspiration is to start farming to improve her income. She lives in rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Belinha

texts.en:
Belinha is applying for a loan of $1500.00 to improve her business. She is running a beauty salon shop.  

She is making a good income from a beauty salon and she wants to buy more needed items with the loan. She is living a town near by the main road, so many people come to her beauty salon shop and she opens every day. She opened her this year with her own working capital $ 3500.00

loans.use: To buy beauty salon items

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara has a kiosk of various items, and that is the business she started 7 years ago with her own capital of $2,000.

She wants now to make her business bigger by adding more items in her kiosk. She does have enough money, so that is why she is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will buy a lot of items, mainly mineral water, soaps, eggs, and others for reselling them and making more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as mineral water, cooking oil, eggs, lotions, soaps and others

loans.name: Kohinur

texts.en:
Kohinur is a 32-year-old, married woman from Falakata. She lives with her husband, Mahabbat Ali, and three children (two sons and a daughter) in the village of Jogendrapur. Her husband and one son jointly run a poultry business. Others are studying in a village school.

Her husband's poultry business provides no consistent income. It is difficult for him to bear all the household expenses and give the family all the basic needs in terms of food or health. Moreover, to bear the education expenses of her children creates a burden on him. As Kohinur has her own animal husbandry, she started a business of selling milk to the people of her locality. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk, and thus, contributes to her family's income. 

She now wants to sell milk and cattle byproducts like cow dung, which is used as fuel in the remote region, to generate an extra amount of profit. So she has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase another dairy cow. 

She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her because she will earn more profit from her business. She aspires to give a better education to her children with the profit generated, and she aspires to expand her business by buying more cows.

She conveys her thanks to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Asha A.

texts.en: Asha is 22 years old and lives in the Kilosa district. She is a tailor and is requesting a loan in order to purchase fabric in bulk to increase her profit margin. She plans to use the profit she earns to open a physical stall for her tailoring business. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students in the nearby high school. She focuses on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence.  Asha’s dream is to open her own clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in bulk

loans.name: Kadogo

texts.en: Kadogo is 27 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in the Pangani district. She runs a retail shop and requests a loan in order to purchase her products in bulk to increase her profit margin. She plans to use the profit she earns to support her family's daily needs. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students in the nearby high school. She focuses on teaching effective communication and on building her students’ confidence.

loans.use: to purchase her products in bulk

loans.name: Thaher

texts.en:
Thaher is a 40-years-old divorced man from Jabalia city. He lives alone in a small simple house. Thaher works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.

Thaher took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will enable him to provide hot water without using electricity.
Thaher appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and save on electricity bills

loans.name: Nurzina

texts.ru: Нурзина успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 бычка, 2 лошади и 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Нурзина вновь обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Нурзина намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала ее семьи, также она планирует сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en: Nurzina successfully repaid her loan, having used it for its intended purpose. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and to everyone who helped to finance her. Now she has three bull-calves, two horses and fifteen sheep. Her monthly income is about 15,000 som (KGS). Nurzina has applied once more to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy bull-calves for fattening and resale. Nurzina intends to expand her business, which will inevitably lead to an increase in her family's capital, and she also plans to carry out renovations of her house.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves for fattening and subsequent resale.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Analou has been in this business for 2 years. Analou earns more income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Analou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2011 with money of her own of $3,000 as capital. She sells t-shirts, trousers, pants, and handkerchiefs that are locally very appreciated. The business is going well and she even wants to do better by adding more clothes to the shop.

In addition to her own money, she needs an extra amount to cover the expenses for adding more items to the shop. She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to restock her shop beyond what she is used to.

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as trousers, t-shirts, handkerchiefs, pants and others

loans.name: Over Bladimir

texts.es:
Bladimir un hombre con 26 años, soltero y con un hijo de 19 meses, se dedica a trabajar en una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar en Gomez Plata.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y así tener una vivienda propia.

Solicito un crédito en la Corporación Interactuar para abastecer su negocio comprando gaseosas, mecato y otros.

Quiere seguir creciendo y expandir su negocio, con su apoyo Bladimir podrá seguir su sueño.
texts.en:
Bladimir, who is 26 years old, is single and has a 19-month-old son. He makes a living working in a shop selling essential family groceries in Gomez Plata.

His dream is to carry on working and so have a house of his own. He is asking for a loan from Corporación Interactuar in order to stock up his business by buying fizzy drinks, snacks and other items. He wants to continue growing and expanding his business, and with your support Bladimir will be able to follow his dream.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, snacks and other items.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en: Mwanamvua is a 19-year-old entrepreneur, living with her parents in the Pangani District of Tanzania. She requests a Kiva loan in order to launch a retail shop selling products such as garlic, salt, onions, tomatoes, and bell peppers. She plans to use the profit she earns to support her parents' daily needs. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, helping local secondary-school students discover their own strengths and leading discussion groups about how they can create a better world. Mwanamvua dreams of opening her own retail shop.

loans.use: to launch a retail shop

loans.name: Mwanafaki

texts.en: Mwanafaki is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Pangani, Tanzania. She runs a small baking business and is requesting a loan in order to purchase her supplies in bulk to increase her profit margin. She plans to use the profit she earns to pay schools fees to keep her children in school and continue supporting her family's daily needs. She volunteers as a Camfed Core trainer, working with learner guides in making sure that learner guides are delivering sessions to secondary schools in Pangani. She focuses on developing their business acumen and sharing her own experiences of the challenges they might face.

loans.use: to purchase bulk supplies for her baking business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her grocery store business and profit

loans.name: Johan Norbey

texts.es:
Johan un hombre de 24 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos, dedicado a trabajar en un taller de mecánica en Rionegro.

Su sueño es comprar una vivienda y así tener una vida un poco más estable.

Con el crédito solicitado en la Corporación Interactuar Johan comprara insumos como pintura, llantas, entre otros.

Usted puede ser parte de este sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Johan is a 24-year-old man, single and without children. He makes a living working in a mechanic shop in Rionegro.

Hi dream is to buy a home and in this way have a life that is a bit more stable.

With the requested loan in the Corporación Interactuar Johan, he will buy supplies like paint, tires, etc.

You can be part of this dream, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as paint, tires, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 20 years old and lives with her parents in Pangani, Tanzania. She wants to runs a small restaurant and is requesting a loan in order to purchase new equipment. She plans to use the profit she earns to support her parents' daily needs. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions with students at her local high school. She covers topics such as active citizenship and personal confidence. Amina dreams of hiring employees to work in her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to start a restaurant

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 20-year-old entrepreneur and lives with her parents, husband and their child in the Kilombero district. 

She requests a loan in order to launch a venture selling rice. She plans to use the profit she earns to support her family's daily needs. Emma also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students in the nearby high school. She focuses on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence. Emma dreams of building a sturdy house for her family.

loans.use: to launch a venture selling rice

loans.name: Dilson Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando un hombre con  de 22, sin hijos, dedicado a realizar trabajos de campo desde muy pequeño, gracias a las enseñas de su padre.

El sueño de este hombre es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda

Con el préstamo Orlando comprara insecticidas y abonos para el cultivo con el fin de que incrementen sus ganancias

Usted puede aportar a este sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Orlando is a 22 year old man, he has no children, and has been doing work in the field since he was quite young thanks to the teachings of his father.

His dream is to improve the conditions of his residence.

With the loan Orlando will buy pesticides and fertilizers for growing crops with the goal of increasing his income.

you can support this dream, make a loan.

loans.use: buy pesticides and fertilizers for growing crops with the goal of increasing his income.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
ROSA AMLIA TIENE 53 AÑOS, SOLTERA, VIVE CON SU MAMÁ VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA, EN EL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ.

ROSA AMELIA SE DEDICA A VENTA DE BEBIDAS Y PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD,BODEGA AL PÚBLICO EN GENERAL. ADEMÁS CRÍA ANIMALES DE CORRAL,EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO SERÁ LA INVERSIÓN MERCADERÍA PARA AUMENTAR EL STOCK DE SU NEGOCIO CON ELLO ATENDERÁ LA DEMANDA INSATISFECHA EN EL LUGAR, AMPLIARÁ SU CARTERA DE CLIENTES,CON ELLO GENERARÁ MAYORES INGRESOS Y PODRÁ MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia is 53 years old, single, and lives with her mother in a community where the economic drivers are commerce, agriculture and livestock raising. It is located in the Cayalti district in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. 
Rosa Amelia makes a living selling drinks and basic need products to the general public. She also raises stable animals. 
The loan will be a used as a merchandise investment in order to increase the stock of her business which will allow her to attend to the unsatisfied demand in the area. It will also broaden her client base and this will help generate better incomes and she will be able to increase her quality of life.

loans.use: invest in merchandize to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 35-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two kids in a small simple house. Issa works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.

Issa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will enable him to provide hot water without using electricity.
Issa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water to save on utilities bills

loans.name: Insherah

texts.en:
Insherah is a 35-years-old married woman from Qabatiya, a village near Jenin city. she is a mother for five sons. Her husband has a grocery store in the village. It is a good business but  the income does not cover all the family needs. 

Insherah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank to store the hot water. This will reduce the electricity usage. 
Insherah appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank to store the hot water.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 60 years old and married with six children. 

Anecita is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her chickens.

Anecita has been raising chickens for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Anecita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Cristyl

texts.en:
Cristyl is 27 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Cristyl works very hard to provide for them.

Cristyl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, candies, biscuits, cereals, etc. to sell.

Cristyl has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, candies, biscuits, cereals, etc. 

Cristyl would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, candies, biscuits, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Vilma

texts.en:
Ma. Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making hollow blocks in the Philippines. Ma. Vilma requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like sand, cement, etc. for her business.

Ma. Vilma has been in this business for 15 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like sand, cement, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ma. Diana

texts.en:
Ma. Diana is a married woman with 11 children, five of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Diana is 47 years old.

Ma. Diana has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

Ma. Diana has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Diana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Marlyn has been in this business for 40 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Luis Javier

texts.es:
Luis un joven con 22 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos, trabajador independiente desea abrir su primer negocio, un almacén de ropa con su propia marca.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y comprarse una vivienda.

Solicito un préstamo con el cual surtirá su almacén de camisetas, con esto espera mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ganancias.

Aporta al sueño de este joven, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Luis, age 22, is single and does not have children.  He is hard-working and independent.  He wishes to open his first business, a clothing store with his own brand.

His dream is to continue working and to buy a house.

He requested a loan to stock his store with t-shirts.  With this he hopes to improve his sales and increase his earnings.

Contribute to this young man’s dream and lend today.

loans.use: to stock his store with t-shirts.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastián un joven con 19 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos, con un espíritu emprendedor, por necesidad económica él desea montar su propio negocio, un CAFÉ BAR, con el fin de cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.

Su sueño es  ahorrar dinero de su trabajo y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Sebastián solicito un préstamo con el cual el comprara una licorera, estanterías, y lo surtirá de tabaco, mecato y licor.

Aporta al sueño de este joven, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Sebastian is a 19 year old young man, he is single and does not have any children. He has an entrepreneurial spirit and because of economic necessity he wants to start his own business, a cafe bar, with the goal of covering his home's needs. 

His dream is to save up money from his work and improve the conditions of his residence. 

Sebastian is requesting a loan which will allow him to purchase an establishment, display cases and stock them with tobacco, snacks and liquor.

Support this young man's dream, please make a loan.

loans.use: buy an establishment, display cases and stock them with tobacco, snacks and liquor.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Хафиза,48 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Хафиза на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Хафизы имеется 2 коровы, а также есть поливная земля размером 0,36 ГА, на которой выращивается картофель, огурцы, помидоры и прочие овощи. Сельскохозяйственная деятельность Хафизы приносит около 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока, часть средств будет потрачено на культивацию земли, покупку семян для выращивания органических овощей. Доходы от кредита Хафиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Hafiza is 48 years old, married, with three children.  She has a secondary education.  Her husband and the children help her with the farm work.  Hafiza has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for the past 15 years.  Today, she has two cows on her farm and she also has 0.36 hectares of irrigated land on which she grows potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes and other vegetables.  Thanks to her farming activity, Hafiza makes an income of about 18,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, Hafiza has turned to Bai Tushum Bank and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a few dairy cows in order to sell larger volumes of organic milk.  She will use the remainder of her loan to buy seeds to grow organic vegetables.  Hafiza is planning to use the proceeds from her loan to further expand her farming business.  In the future, she would also like to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy a few dairy cows in order to sell larger volumes of organic milk and to buy seeds to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 31 год, замужем, есть 6 детей, 3 из них учатся в школе. У Бурулкан среднее образование, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть корова, 2 овцы. На 1,0 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу и клевер для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан на сегодняшний день ее прибыль составляет 8,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока. Бурулкан планирует расширить ее бизнес и накопить средства на образование ее детей.
texts.en: Burulkan is 31 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom go to school. Burulkan has a secondary education. She rears animals and grows crops. She has a cow and two sheep. She grows corn and clover for sale on 1.0 hectares of land. Thanks to Burulkan's hard work, her profit today is 8,800 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Burulkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of sales of organic milk. Burulkan plans to expand her business and save up funds for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase her organic milk sales.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-years-old single young man from a village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Ahmad's father works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family house. This will enable him to provide hot water without using electricity.
Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family house.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 44 year-old married woman with 4 children. Her eldest is 20 and her youngest is fourteen. Her  husband is a plumber. Irene runs a sari-sari (convenience) store business in Ronda, Cebu  where she also lives with her family. She sells items like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, soap and shampoo.

 Irene has requested this loan to buy bath soap, detergent, canned sardines, beef loaf, corned beef, sugar, coffee  and vinegar. Irene plans to use her profit to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy bath soap, detergent, canned sardines, beef loaf, corned beef, sugar, coffee  and vinegar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candies, canned foods, seasoning, shampoo, soy sauce, noodles, eggs and condiments

loans.name: Dema

texts.en:
Dema is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dema is 38 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Dema has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Dema requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, etc. for her business.

Dema has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Dema would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janet is 42 years old and has three children who are in school.

Janet has a general store business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Janet has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juán

texts.es: Juán, tiene la edad  de 58 años, está casado, vive con su esposa, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  materiales para poder hacer la construcción de cajones para las abejas y marcos para que elaboren la miel, ademas de comprar alimentación para darle a las abejas en os periodos que no tienen donde coseguir alimento.  La idea es aprovechar el espacio y las buenas áreas montañosas que tiene y las buenas condiciones para ubicar los apiarios. Además de obtener mejores condiciones para la reproducción de nuevos núcleos y con animales que tengan un mayor rendimiento en la producción de miel y con un alto nivel de manipulación. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar mejor la actividad, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más colmenas e invertir más en el proyecto y a la vez darle más ingresos económicos a su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juán, age 58, is married.  He lives with his wife, who is his greatest priority.  He plans to use the loan to buy materials in order to be able to build boxes for the bees and frames for them to make the honey.  He will also buy food to give the bees during the times when they do not have a place to get food.

The idea is to take advantage of the space; the good, mountainous area that he has; and the good conditions in which to locate the apiaries.  He will also be getting better conditions to reproduce new nuclei with bees that have a better output in the production of honey and a high level of manipulation.

With this purchase he will be able to better develop his business activity.  At the same time, he will have savings that will allow him to have more hives and invest more in the project.  This will also give him more income for his family.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other loans from state banks before.  FUDECOSURE has provided him with a loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to produce honey.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 36 years divorced with 6 children, all attending school living in Kasese Uganda. She has a retail shop of general merchandise and has been in business since 2012. She works 10hrs a day throughout the whole week. She earns her side income through farming activities. 

She is in need of a loan to buy sugar, soap, yellow bananas, and other merchandise for selling. She is hardworking but faces a challenge of having limited capital to buy enough stock. She has a dream of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, yellow bananas, and other merchandise for selling in her general store

loans.name: Wilson Alonso

texts.es:
Wilson con 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de 2 hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a diversas actividades de manera independiente, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Hace 10, comenzó a realizar la actividad de comercialización de cerdos, pues los compra, los cría, engorda y posteriormente los vende según el peso adquirido por el animal, esto le permite obtener los recursos para continuar con el cuidado y sustento de sus hijos. 

El titular es un hombre luchador, pujante, se esmera cada día para salir adelante motivado por su familia, esto lo impulsó a solicitar el crédito con la Corporación Interactuar, para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y lechones, así podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan y mejorará su margen de utilidad e ingresos. 

De esta manera, Wilson espera avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de sus principales sueños, que son mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y lograr una estabilidad económica para darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de una mejor educación y tener buenas condiciones de vida.

Mejora la vida de este colombiano con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Wilson, who is 36 years old, lives with his partner and is the father of 2 children. During his working life he has worked independently in various activities and by doing this he has generated income to support his family. 

Ten years ago he started out in the business of selling pigs, so he buys them, raises them, fattens them up and later sells them according to the weight gained by each animal. This allows him to have the resources to continue looking after and providing for his children. Wilson is a determined man with a lot of drive and he puts in a lot of effort each day in order to make progress, motivated by his family. 

This is what has inspired him to ask Corporación Interactuar for the loan, so he can invest in buying pigs and suckling pigs. By doing this he will have sufficient availability to fulfil the orders which people ask for and will improve his profit margin and income. 

In this way Wilson hopes to move a step closer towards fulfilling his big dreams, which are to improve the condition of his home and achieve financial stability so he can give his children the opportunity to have a better education and good living conditions.

Improve this Colombian's life with a loan!

loans.use: to buy pigs and suckling pigs in order to have sufficient availability to fulfil his orders.

loans.name: Jorge Andres

texts.es:
Andrés un joven con 20 años, soltero y sin hijos, desea montar su primer negocio, una sala de Video Juegos, con el fin de de ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

El sueño de este joven es comprar una vivienda para él y sus padres.

Solicito un préstamo con el que comprar Xbox, televisor, play, y estanterías.
El espera formalizar su negocio y más adelante generar empleo a personas que lo necesiten.

Su préstamo ayudara Andrés invertir en un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Andrés is a 20-year-old young man, single and without children. He hopes to put together his first business, a Video Game lounge, with the goal of helping his family to get ahead. 

The dream of this young man is to buy a home for him and his parents. 

He requested a loan to purchase and Xbox, television, play, and shelves.

He hopes to formalize his business and later create jobs for people who need them. 

Your loan will help Andrés to invest in a better future.

loans.use: to buy an Xbox, television, play, and shelves.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a 19-year-old entrepreneur and lives with her parents in the Kilombero district. She requests a loan in order to launch a venture in selling bananas. She plans to use the profit she earns to support her family's daily needs. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students in the nearby high school. She focuses on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence Fatuma’s dream is to continue with further Education.

loans.use: to launch a venture in selling bananas

loans.name: Iosebi

texts.en:
Iosebi is from Telavi district, east Georgia. He lives with his father, wife and two children. Iosebi is involved in agricultural activities. He owns a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where he grows maize. Iosebi is very hardworking man and does his best to ensure in a good harvest. He sells harvested products locally.

Iosebi wants to start additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for trading business. Iosebi has a small commercial space in city center and wants to renovate it. 

After renovation he will purchase clothes and will open a clothes shop. He hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a new small clothes shop

loans.name: Wesam

texts.en:
Wesam is a 30-years-old married man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife and one son in a small simple house. Wesam works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.This is the only source of income to the family.

Wesam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will enable him to provide hot water without using electrity. 
Wesam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru: Эту мужчину зовут Усмон. Усмону 48 лет. Он проживает в Кубадиен. Старшие дети вместе матерью занимаются торговлей деятельностью на рынке. Младшие учатся в средней школе. Усмон занимается земледелием, и он больше времени проводят на земле. Он много трудится, чтобы обеспечить семью и улучшить условия жизни семьи. Усмон хочет купить минеральные удобрения, чтобы обработать землю для сева урожая. Минеральные удобрения помогает, уничтожит насекомых, и получить качественный урожай, по этой причине Усмон обратился за кредитом. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет вести бизнес. Усмону очень важен это кредит.
texts.en: This man is called Usmon. Usmon is 48 years old. He lives in Qubadiyon. His eldest children and their mother are traders at the market. His youngest children are studying in secondary school. Usmon grows crops, and spends most of his time on the land. He works a lot in order to provide for his family and improve his family's living conditions. Usmon wants to buy mineral fertilizer in order to prepare his land for planting a crop. The mineral fertilizer helps both to kill insects and to get a good quality harvest, and for this reason Usmon has applied for a loan. The requested loan will help him to run his business. This loan is very important to Usmon.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new electric clippers and pay for his barber shop renovation

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 49 years old and has five children. Yolanda is married and has three children who are still in school.

Yolanda is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Yolanda has been raising chickens for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Mileydys

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Mileydys, quien con su credikiva pudo surtir su negocio con nueva mercancía permitiéndole incrementar sus ventas y cumplir con sus compromisos, gracias a las utilidades obtenidas en el ejercicio de su actividad; por eso ella dice a los financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por la ayuda, Dios siga bendiciéndolos”. En la actualidad está aplicando su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprará exclusivamente prendas de vestir y responderá a encargos de sus clientes. Su credikiva nuevamente será todo un éxito gracias a su compromiso y dedicación.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Mileydys, who was able to stock her business with new merchandise with her Kiva loan, allowing her to increase her sales  and meet her commitments as a result of the profits she made in carrying out her business. This is why she says to Kiva lenders "Thank you for your help and may God continue to bless you".

Currently she is applying for her second Kiva loan which she will use exclusively to buy clothing and meet her customers' orders. Her Kiva loan will once again be a total success thanks to her commitment and dedication.

loans.use: to buy exclusively clothing.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a stakeholder at Daystar Junior Academy, a school in
Nairobi’s Mathare informal settlement. The school that has operated
for less than a year now is quickly gaining popularity among Mathare
residents: so far it has enrolled two hundred and seventy pupils.

With the consistent increase in student enrollment at Daystar Junior
Academy, expansion of facilities for the students is inevitable; key
among the priorities has been increasing toilet facilities
While on the lookout for various options, Patrick discovered the
existence of Fresh Life Toilets at a neighboring school. Cleanliness
and the ability to easily to maintain Fresh Life Toilets were among
the qualities he liked hence the motivation to join Sanergy’s
movement.

Patrick believes that the installation of Fresh Life Toilets at
Daystar Junior Academy will not only provide students with adequate
toilets but will greatly contribute towards boosting overall
sanitation levels in the school.

loans.use: To pay for two Fresh Life Toilets at his school, thus providing a safe environment for his students

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 37-years-old married woman from Jabalia city. she is a mother for two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a worker where he gets a low income.  

Huda took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank to store hot water. This will reduce the electricity usage. 
Huda appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for hot water storage.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 55 years old from Alegria, Cebu. She is a widow with nine children. Some of her children are still attending school. Cresencia is dependent on the income that she generate from farming vegetables such as eggplants, bitter gourd and string beans. 

She is asking a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides that she can use to protect her crops from diseases and keep them robust. She hope that through the loan, she can further expand her farming in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 57 years old from Alegria, Cebu. She is a married woman who learned farming from her husband. For twenty five years, she has been farming vegetables like bitter gourd and string beans. She is struggling with her needs for farm inputs this season. 

She is requesting for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm so she can continue her livelihood. Alberta has a high hopes for the future with her hard work.
It has been her dream to expand her business and own more lands for a  better profit in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetable production business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 49 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Joyce has a general store business in the Philippines. Joyce requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Joyce has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Joyce would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Armik

texts.en:
Armik is 48 years old. He is married and lives in Akhalkalaki district with his wife and son. Armik has got a car and serves people as a taxi driver. His wife and son work at local beer company and they both monthly salary. 

Armik wants to start an additional business along his activity and requested a loan.
The start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for starting trading business. Armik will purchase fruits and vegetables with the received credit and will trade in order to get more income.

loans.use: to begin trading in fruits and vegetables as extra income

loans.name: Rozahan

texts.ru: Розахан, 62 года, замужем, 3 детей. У Розахан средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2002 года занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, на  1,85 Га земли, она выращивает фасоль, клубнику. Ежемесячная прибыль- 15,000 сом (KGS), что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Розахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян для полеводства и выращивания экологически чистых продуктов. Доходы от кредита Розахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Rozahan is 62 and married with three children. She has a specialist secondary education and has been working in agriculture since 2002 as the primary source of income for her family. She currently has three cows on her farm as well as 1.85 hectares of land where she grows beans and strawberries. Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS, which covers basic food and living expenses for her family.

With the goal of further developing her business, Rozahan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow organic produce. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow organic produce

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 56 años, está casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales todos están casados, Eugenia se dedica a producir café bajo diferentes sellos de certificación bajo la dirección técnica de COCAFCAL de la cual es socia, Eugenia a su edad tiene muchas necesidades y las ayudas de sus hijos no son lo suficiente
La producción de café de café bajo certificación orgánica es una novedad en la región ya que ayuda a tener mejores mercados y mejores precios por el café haciendo la producción más rentable, Eugenia quiere convertir su parcela a producción orgánica ya que esto haría que los ingresos por su café sean un poco mayores.
En estos momentos Eugenia tiene 0.5 hectáreas a disposición para la conversión a producción orgánica y para la conversión necesita comprar diferentes materiales por lo que está solicitando un crédito.
Un crédito ayudaría a Eugenia a tener mercados fijos para su café, a obtener mejores precios, con las ganancias obtenidas ella podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 56 years old, married, and has 6 children who are all married. She makes a living producing coffee under different seals of certification. She is a member of the COCAFCAL group, which provides her with technical management. At her age, Eugenia has many needs and her children’s help isn’t enough. 

Producing coffee under the organic certification is novel in the region, so organic coffee reaches better markets and higher prices, making its production more profitable. Eugenia wants to convert her plot to organic production since it will increase her income a bit. 

Currently Eugenia has 0.5 hectares available for the conversion to organic production, and she is requesting a loan to purchase different materials required to carry out the conversion. 

One loan will help Eugenia have steady markets to sell her coffee at better prices, and with the earnings she will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic manure, coffee plants, and other necessary materials for converting to organic coffee production.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a 22-year-old entrepreneur and lives in the Kilombero district. She requests a loan in order to launch a venture selling rice. 

She plans to use the profit she earns to purchase basic necessities for herself and save a portion of her profit for her future family. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students in the nearby high school. She focuses on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence.

loans.use: to launch a venture selling rice

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is 38 years old. She lives in village Shalauri in Telavi district with her parents and sister. She works at a museum and gets monthly income. In addition, the family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 cows and produce dairy products and a small vineyard. 

Natalia wants to start trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for trading business. With the received credit she will purchase clothes and home products to resell and generate needed extra income.

Natalia is very hardworking woman and has a great desire to be involved in her own business. She hopes that trading business will be profitable.

loans.use: to begin to trade home products and clothes, to provide needed extra income

loans.name: Mersita

texts.en:
Mersita, 44, is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for seven years and earns additional income from food vending. 

Mersita has previously borrowed and paid 10 loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She has requested a new loan, of 15,000 Philippine pesos, through NWTF. She will use this loan to purchase more items to sell, such as detergent, fabric conditioners, canned goods, candies, noodles and soft drinks.

Mersita aspires to saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, fabric conditioners, canned goods, candies, noodles, soft drinks and other items to sell

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth, 39, is married with four children, three who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Naneth has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional materials for her business, such as wood, paint and gasoline.

Naneth would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business, such as wood, paint and gasoline.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liezel is 40 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Liezel has a buy and sell glass business in the Philippines. Liezel requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of glass to sell.

Liezel has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of glass to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 45 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks like coffee, milk, juice, eggs, bread, beer, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, milk, juice, eggs, bread, beer, etc.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like coffee, milk, juice, eggs, bread, and beer to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a father of five children all of whom live with their
mother in Kisii. Providing for his family has been his primary goal
and for the fifteen years he has lived in Nairobi, he has been working
as a public civil servant. In addition, he has been on the lookout for
business opportunities to venture in with the extra money he saves.

Five years ago, Richard managed to establish rental units in Viwandani
that have been home to ten households. The business had been doing
well until recently; there is a high turnover of tenants owing to the
lack of toilet facilities in his plot.

In the past, his tenants have been using neighboring toilet facilities
at a nominal fee. As Viwandani is fast expanding, so is the demand for
better and high quality housing units. As such Richard too is also in
the process of revamping his rental units. As he says, Fresh Life
Toilets have gained popularity and community acceptance hence his
motivation to join the movement.

He believes that a Fresh Life Toilet will not only provide clean and
accessible toilet facilities to his tenants, but will also help
inspire hygienic practices such as hand washing among community
members at his plot.

loans.use: To pay for One Fresh life Toilet at his rental units, to provide a safe and healthy environment for his tenants needs

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.en:
Wilmer has worked more than 18 years in agriculture growing corn and beans, and he also works in cattle farming. He and his family do not have access to electricity, so they have purchase kerosene and battery-powered lamps in order to have some lights. 

Wilmer needs this loan to obtain a solar energy system, which will not only help him have better illumination during the harvest time, but also help his wife with her household work. With this solar power, Wilmer knows he will see his family's quality of life improve.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system to improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 63, is married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and she sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, candies, snack foods, coffee, sugar, sanitary pads and bath soap. 

Teresita has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell.

Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Margarita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer trabajadora, organizada y perseverante, dedicada a su familia y apasionada por su labor. 

Desde hace 15 años es comerciante independiente, tiene una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en el municipio de Medellín, allí trabaja todos los días, increíblemente, durante 14 horas; cuenta con la ventaja de no tener mucha competencia, por lo que ya es reconocido su negocio por los diferentes ciudadanos que se han convertido en sus principales clientes. 

Con el apoyo del crédito fortalecerá sus inventarios comprando snacks, dulces, granos, licores, galletería, entre otros; esto le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes y así aumentar las ventas. 

Margarita manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo y acreditando su negocio, para que le garantice mayor rentabilidad y así tener la capacidad económica para adquirir una casa propia en la que pueda disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking, organized, and persevering woman, devoted to her family and passionate about her work. For 15 years, she has been an independent trader. She has a grocery store located in the city of Medellín; there, she works every day, incredibly, for 14 hours. She has the advantage of not having much competition, so her business is already recognized by different citizens who have become her major customers.

With the support of the loan, she will strengthen her inventories buying snacks, sweets, grains, liquors, biscuits, among others. This will allow her to have a greater variety of products available to offer to her customers and thus increase sales.

Margarita says that her greatest wish is to continue strengthening and accrediting her business so that it guarantees her greater profitability and therefore have the economic capacity to acquire a house of her own in which she can enjoy a better quality of life in the company of her family.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sweets, grains, liquors, biscuits, among others.

loans.name: Yadira Isabel

texts.es:
Yadira es una mujer de 28 años de edad que se dedica a atender su negocio de servicios de alquiler de consolas de videojuegos, actividad que inicio en el año 2013 por necesidad económica y en la que ha visto buenos resultados económicos que han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de su hogar que esta formado pro su pareja y dos hermosas princesas de 9 y 6 añso de edad.

Yadira quiere solicitar un préstamo la razón es que busca ampliar la capacidad de su negocio y actualizar algunos televisores por otros de tecnología más avanzada, por ello el dinero será destinado en la compra de 2 televisores y una consola play 3
texts.en:
Yadira is a 28 year old woman who makes her living running a shop that rents video game consoles, a business that she started in 2013 for economic necessities. She has seen great financial results that have helped to improve the conditions of her home, which she shares with her partner and two adorable sweethearts who are 9 and 6 years old. 

Yadira wants to request a loan in order to increase the capacity of her shop and upgrade some televisions, for those who are more technologically advanced. Thus, the money will be used to buy two televisions and a Play 3 console.

loans.use: to buy 2 televisions and a Play 3 console.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, a mother of six and lives in Nairobi’s Kiambiu informal
settlement is a budding entrepreneur. She successfully runs a water
vending and tailoring business. This year, she has achieved yet
another goal of expanding her business ventures by establishing rental
units for Kiambiu residents.

Sanitation in Kiambiu has not been easy to achieve, there are hardly
any toilets within plots and open defecation is frequent. Ruth is
determined to see the end to open defecation and is leading her
community by example and joining the Fresh Life movement.

She has resolved to establish Fresh Life Toilets that will serve
residents at her rental units as well as the neighboring community.
Towards this goal, let us help Ruth in acquiring one Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.use: To pay for One Fresh Life Toilet for her rental unit to prevent public defecaction

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en:
Nduku is married and the mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development.

She is a subsistence farmer and mainly grows maize and beans for sale. She also operates a kiosk to supplement her income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy foodstuffs e.g. tea leaves, salt, cooking oil, paraffin and bread to add stock to her kiosk to expand her business for increased income.

Nduku is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs e.g. tea leaves, salt and cooking oil to add stock to her kiosk in an effort to expand her business for increased income.

loans.name: Ansam

texts.en:
Ansam is a 22-years-old single lady from Atteel, a village near Tulkarm city. He father is a retired employee where he gets a very simple salary. Ansam is a student in the university where she studies Business administration. She would like to take the BA degree and find a well paying job in the future to support her family. 

Ansam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay for the new semester. By taking this loan, Ansam will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has. 
Ansam appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay for her college semester fee in Business Administration, which will enable her to find a well paying job later

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more life jackets for tourists and pay for boat repair

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a 41 year old lady, married and the mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development.

She is a small scale poultry farmer and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more indigenous poultry and chicken feed. This will increase her income levels to enable her to pay school fees for her children and in future put up a better house for her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more indigenous poultry and feed to boost her poultry business and increase her income to pay school fees and provide a better house for her family.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en:
Vadim is divorced and has one adult son. He has his own small business. Vadim offers shoe repair services. He owns a small kiosk where he does his work. He is a good shoe specialist and hardworking person.

Vadim lives in a small house. He is asking for a loan of 10 000 UAH to renovate a bathroom and install a plumbing system in the house. Vadim wants to put tiles on the walls and floor and paint the ceiling.

The new finishing will decrease humidity in the bathroom.

loans.use: to renovate a bathroom and install a plumbing system in his house

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 49 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. Laura is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Laura requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Laura has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is a military man and lives with his family in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region. He has two sons and his elder son is in up-broad work in the Russian Federation, and from time to time helps his family in Armenia. Arayik’s wife is a jobless, so days and nights he works hard in order to solve his family needs and takes care of his junior son. 

As salaries are not much, for more than five years Arayik has engaged in furniture production, which he set up in a workshop in front of his house. After his military working day, Arayik produces furniture and sells it, which brings him a good profit. The main clients of Arayik’s furniture are his colleagues, neighbors, relatives and mutual people from his city. His production is popular as it is well designed, with high quality and affordable prices, which allows him to have a large number of furniture offers. 

Arayik needs a loan with amount of 400,000 AMD in order to buy new equipment and row materials such wood and laminate flooring for his production. 

He hopes that his second deal with Kiva lenders will be profitable for his business; he sends his greetings to lenders beforehand.

loans.use: to buy wood and laminate for his furniture production

loans.name: Olga Ligia

texts.es:
Trabajadora, luchadora, aguerrida, preocupada por su familia así son las madres del campo, personas como Olga que diariamente le dedican a su actividad de 10 a 12 horas.

Olga tiene su negocio independiente de cría de ganado bovino, pero diariamente le colabora a su esposo en el campo, son personas muy unidas que con trabajo colectivo han sacado su familia adelante, un hogar conformado por 3 hijos de 13, 15 y 19 años de edad futuros herederos del negocio que están consolidando.

Olga para potenciar y aprovechar más los espacios que tiene en su campo, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de ganando de levante.

El mayor beneficio que recibirá Olga es tener más animales para negociar y aumentar su utilidad.
texts.en:
Hard-working, fighters, family-focused: all words to describe mothers in the countryside, people like Olga who work very day for 10 or 12 hours to support their families.  

Olga has an independent business raising bovine cattle, but she also works in the fields everyday with her husband. They are very united and with their combined efforts they have been able to support their family and build a comfortable family home for their three children aged 13, 15 and 19 years old. Their children will inherit the business that Olga and her husband have established. 

To make the most of the space they have, Olga is seeking a loan to buy cattle to raise. This will allow Olga to have more animals for her business and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This 54 year-old woman whose name is Bella lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Bella lives with her husband, son and pensioner mother-in-law. Bella graduated from Technical College of Kapan city and has a qualification of laboratory worker.  She used to work in different organizations and now Bella works in a hospital as a nurse. Bella and her husband are working hard days and nights in order to solve their family needs.

A few months ago there was a tragedy in the family.  Her father-in-law has died. Bella’s family needs a loan amount of 350,000 AMD for a tombstone to be installed at her father–in-law’s grave. She hopes to receive Kiva lenders' kind support.

loans.use: to purchase a tombstone at her father –in-law’s grave

loans.name: Kamanthe

texts.en:
Kamanthe is 57 years old, married and a mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming i.e. crops and poultry. To supplement her income, she grows and sells fruit such as avocados, mangoes and oranges. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more indigenous chicken, chicken feed and vaccines to boost her poultry farming business for increased income and to satisfy her customers' demands.

She is grateful to Kiva and lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more indigenous chicken, chicken feed and vaccines to boost her poultry business to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура 42 летняя замужняя женщина. Она живет на районе Кубадиен с мужем и детьми. Муж вместе старшими детьми занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Дети взрослые, умные и самостоятельные. Манзура тоже не может сидеть дома без дел. У нее тоже имеется собственный бизнес. Она занимается растениеводством. Манзура любить свою семью, и старается ради них как ее муж. Она закончила посев и готовится к обработки земли минеральными удобрениями. К сожалению, у Манзуры проблема финансам. И она решила взять кредит и приобрести минеральные удобрения. Манзура надеется, что ее поддержат с финансовыми трудностями.
texts.en:
Manzura is a 42-year old married woman. She lives in the Qubadiyon region together with her husband and her children.
Her husband and her eldest children repair houses. Manzura's children are grown up, smart, and independent. 
Manzura herself also can't sit idly at home. She has her own business - she cultivates crops. Manzura loves her family, and is working hard to provide for it, just like her husband. She has already finished sowing and is getting readyto fertilize the soil with mineral fertilizers. 
Unfortunately, Manzura has financial problems. So she decided to take out a loan and purchase the mineral fertilizers. Manzura hopes for your support with her financial issues.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for soil fertilizing. .

loans.name: Tania Estefani

texts.es: Tania de 19 años de edad quien habita en vivienda propia en compañía de sus padres y hermano, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora quien con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a su familia, quien además recibe el apoyo de su madre en algunas necesidades del hogar. Tania tiene un pequeño negocio de cosmetología con el que ha logrado tener una estabilidad económica debido a que tiene muchos clientes que la buscan por su amabilidad desde hace 2 años. Tania desea construir un cuarto dormitorio en el cual poder descansar luego del arduo trabajo diario, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bloques de cemento, arena, cemento, grava, hierro y lámina para construir un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda.
texts.en: Tania, 19, lives in a home with her parents and a brother. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who, with much sacrificed, has provided for her family, which also receives support from her mother with various household needs. Tania has a small cosmetics store where she has achieved an economic stability, thanks to many clients who have come to her for her kindness for the past two years. Tania wants to construct a bedroom in which she can relax after her arduous daily work. This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI, in order to invest in cement blocks, sand, cement, gravel, iron, and metal sheets, in order to build a bedroom in her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement blocks, sand, cement, gravel, iron, and metal sheets to build a bedroom in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) posee 3 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumo agrícolas como: fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, controles de plagas, insecticida  y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young woman's face is concealed because she lives in a high risk zone. She has been cultivating basic grains (corn and beans) for the past three years. She began with her own capital. She sells her harvests in different local markets near her home.

The young woman lives in her own house with her family. 

She is soliciting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, manure, plague controls, and insecticides, and to improve the land shown in the photograph, in order to continue her work and, as a result, to enjoy a better income.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, herbicides, manure, plague controls, and insecticides, and to improve her land.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane, 60, still produces lemonade as a means of earning income. After her first loan with Nor Horizon and Kiva, her business increased and she started a new business activity, producing bread and bakery products in her workshop close to the family's house. 

Gayane’s son helps her greatly in her business. He uses his car to distribute lemonade to food markets and restaurants in the Lori region. 

Gayane's new bread and bakery business has became popular in her city of Vanadzor. There is now a lot of demand for her breads and bakery products as well as her lemonade, which she produces with the help of her family. 

With her profits, Gayane meets her family's needs and is very happy that, at her age, she is able to work and help her son survive difficult economic situations. 

Gayane needs support from Kiva lenders to buy raw materials, such as flour, oil, sugar and yeast, and new equipment necessary for her production.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as a flour, oil, sugar and yeast, and new equipment necessary for her production

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and all her children attend school.

Jean is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jean has been raising pigs for 16 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jean would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Petros

texts.en:
Petros is 52 year-old man with more than 25 years of working experience in the clothes trading business. He has a rented stall in the clothes market where he sells clothes which he brings from different wholesale markets of Yerevan. 

Petros is married and lives with his wife, daughter and son in Vanadzor city. His son is studying in the Vanadzor branch of State Armenian  Engineering University in the department of Computer Engineering and Informatics. 

Petros’s son does not work due to the lack of jobs and all tuition costs paid by his father. Petros needs a loan in order to pay tuition fees of his son, and trusts to Kiva lenders support for that matter.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees of his son

loans.name: Conforte

texts.fr: Conforte est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans et vit à Baguida. Conforte est une mère de deux enfants qui bénéficient d’une scolarité. Pour être toujours capable de répondre aux besoins quotidiens, Conforte vend de œufs dans son quartier pour satisfaire ses clients et gagner son profit. Conforte s’approvisionne huit fois par mois au  marché. Pour commander quelques plateaux d’œufs afin de réaliser plus de revenus, Conforte demande ce crédit pour financer son achat.
texts.en: Conforte is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Baguida. She is a mother of two children who are currently receiving an education. So that she is always able to meet her daily needs, Conforte sells eggs in her local area in order to satisfy her customers and earn a profit. She gets her supplies eight times per month from market. Conforte is requesting this loan to purchase trays of eggs so she can earn a greater profit.

loans.use: to purchase 24 trays of eggs

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard has been engaged in the clothes trading business for more than 20 years. For a long time she rented a stall in the clothes markets in her city, where she sold both men’s and women's clothes. Due to her profit from the business, she now carries out her clothes trading in her own small shop in Vanadzor city. She imports clothes from neighboring countries and resells them in her shop. Nvard’s husband helps in her commercial activities. Nvard’s clothes shop is very popular and she has a lot of clients from Vanadzor city and also from the nearby villages.

Nvard is 49 years old and she lives with her husband in Vanadzor city. Their children are married and live separately from their parents. Nvard says that she is very thankful for her business. She resolves her family needs and can help her children in the hard economic situation in their region with the profit from her business.

Nvard is seeking a loan from Nor Horizon and hopes Kiva lenders support her in buying the new summer clothes collection and mannequins for her shop.

loans.use: to buy the new summer clothes collection and mannequins for her shop.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit, 35 years old, is a distinguished educator in her city. She lives with her husband and school-aged daughter in Spitak city, which is in the Lori region. Anahit graduated from State Vanadzor Pedagogical Institute of Physics and Mathematics Department. 

For more than 10 years, Anahit has worked as a teacher of physics in one of her city schools.  Anahit enjoys great respect and the admiration of her pupils. After school, she organizes private lessons at her home and helps students prepare for final exams and university entrance exams. Anahit says that a good teacher should always be engaged in a self-education process and should be aware of all the scientific and pedagogical innovations. 

So Anahit is seeking a loan from Nor Horizon and asks Kiva lenders' support for buying a new computer and professional literature in order to improve the quality of her private lessons at her house.

loans.use: for buying a new computer and professional literature in order to improve the quality of her private lessons at her house

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
This smiling young lady, Narine, lives in the village of Azatamut which is in the Tavush region. She is 32 years old and got married last year and lives with her husband and her husband’s parents. Their family is engaged in animal breeding and land cultivating on their farm. Once a year, Narine’s husband goes to up-broad working in the Russian Federation in order to solve his new created family needs. 

On their farm Narine has cattle, pigs and chickens and the meat, eggs, dairy products from her animal breeding activity she sells in regional markets. Narine, with the parents of her husband, also cultivates and sells potatoes, beans, tomatoes, peaches, apples and pears in their large plot of land which is near their house.  

She is full of hopes that with the loan amount from Nor Horizon and with the support of Kiva lenders she will buy a lot of fodder for her animals and buy a few piglets in order to enlarge her farming and to receive a good profit.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for her animals and buy a few piglets in order to enlarge her farming

loans.name: Dongkhammuentai Group

texts.en:
Noy understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Noy knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Noy purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Noy is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years, so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Tepora

texts.en:
Tepora is 27 years old and divorced, with two children. She runs a small business, selling moon pies and donuts in her community and she has been doing this for three years. 

Tepora has requested a loan to buy flour, yeast, cooking oil, containers, a gas oven, etc. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in June 2015 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Tepora will financially support her family and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, cooking oil, containers, a gas oven, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman, 61 years old with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Victoria has a business buying and selling Personal Collection products in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of Personal Collection products to sell to her customers.

Victoria has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of Personal Collection products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli works hard to support her family. She is married with four children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Araceli requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Hakilinyuma Ton Group

texts.fr:
AHOUA est la dame qui tient le mouton  sur la photo.
HAOUA est une malienne âgé de 56 ans non scolarisée, Elle est mariée, mère de 04 enfants tous garçons. Les enfants sont âgés de 2 à 15 ans dont (01) fréquente l’école. Son mari est un cultivateur et fait  l’élevage des ovins. HAOUA fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir bien mener son activité, elle fait l’élevage des ovins. Elle mène cette activité depuis très longtemps. Cette activité la plaise beaucoup. Elle s’approvisionne sur les marchés environnants et revend dans les mêmes marchés.  Le profit la permettra de prendre certaines charges  de sa famille. 
Elle rencontre souvent des problèmes de mévente sur le marché. Dans l’avenir, HAOUA veut faire réussir ses enfants
texts.en: Haoua is the woman holding the sheep in the photo. She is 56 years old and from Mali. She never received an education. She is a married mother to four children, all boys, who are aged between two and 15 years old. One of them is currently attending school. Her husband is a farmer who raises sheep. Haoua turned to RMCR so she could run her sheep-rearing business, which she has been doing for a very long time. She very much enjoys this activity. She gets her livestock from the local markets and resells it at these same markets. The profits will allow her to meet some of her family's needs. She often encounters slumps in sales at market. Haoua wants to give her children a good future.

loans.use: to purchase animals for resale

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 52 years old and lives with her husband and son in Stepanavan city, which is in Lori region, Armenia. Karine is a preschool teacher and she graduated from the Pedagogical Institute. Her husband is a construction company builder and together with Karine they solve their family's needs.

More than 4 years ago, Karine engaged in perfume, lubricant and various jewelry trade businesses in her house.
