She buys goods from Yerevan wholesale markets and specialized stores of cosmetics for the reselling in her city. She is very thankful for the profit from her activity. She has a lot of clients from Stepanavan city and neighboring villages of her region. 

For developing her activity, Karine decided to use online ordering by internet, which should help her easily find a lot of new cosmetic assortments and lubricants and receive a good profit by this way. She asks for a loan amount of 400,000 for buying a new computer and for installing an internet connection in her house.

loans.use: to buy a new computer and for installing an internet connection in her house

loans.name: Daut

texts.ru: Дауту 49 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Старшему ребенку 17 лет, а младшему 3 годика. Даут поздно стал отцом, и благодарит Бога за бесценный ему подарок. Даут занимается животноводством и земледелием. Этими деятельностями он зарабатывает на свою жизнь и жизнь своей семьи. Даут хочет начать новую деятельность. Он будет заниматься продажей арбузов и дыни. Это сезонная работа, но оно принесет ему хороший доход. Он обратился за кредитом, чтобы приобрести первую партию товара.
texts.en:
Daut is 49 years old. He is married and has 2 children. The oldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 3. Daut is a late father, and he is thankful to God for such a priceless gift to him. 
Daut is engaged in cattle breeding and agriculture. With this he provides for himself and his family.
Daut wants to start a new business. He wants to sell melons and watermelons, It's a seasonal job, but it will bring him good income. He applied for the loan in order to purchase first batch of the goods.

loans.use: to buy watermelons and melons

loans.name: N6-Thiệu Đô-Funny Farmers Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thịnh is 31 years old and she is married. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.  She has worked in agriculture, raising pigs for two years.

The main hardship that Thịnh faces is a lack of capital. She is a reputable person in the community.

Although this is Thịnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, every member has agreed to vote her to be the leader of "N6-Thiệu Đô-Funny Farmers Group". 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Thịnh hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: N1 Thôn11 Quảng Lưu Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mrs Quí is 35 years old and she is married. Quí lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this region often suffers from natural disasters such as floods and drought. She has worked in agriculture raising pigs for eight years.
 
The main hardship that Quí faces is a lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Quí joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. Quí has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the leader of "N1 Thôn11 Quảng Lưu Solidarity Group" now.

With her business profit, Quí hopes to build a new house. She also hopes for her business to do well and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Malitina

texts.en:
Malitina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Malitina requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials such as fish net, bamboo, gasoline, and for maintenance for her business. Malitina has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fish net, bamboo, gasoline, and for maintenance for her business

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Rizalyn is 29 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Rizalyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rizalyn has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mariate

texts.en:
Mariate works hard to support her family. She is married with three children and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mariate requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

Mariate has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Cemewanyon Group

texts.fr:
MADOU est  le monsieur qui a la corde du bœuf à la main sur la photo.
MADOU est un malien âgé de 40 ans non scolarisé Il est marié père de 03 enfants, 2 garçons et 1 fille. Les enfants sont âgés de 2 à 12 ans et  dont (01) garçon  fréquente l’école. Sa femme est ménagère. MADOU fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir bien mener son activité, il fait l’élevage des bovins. Il mène cette activité depuis très longtemps. Cette activité lui plait car il y’a beaucoup d’avantages. Il s’approvisionne sur les marchés environnants et revend dans les mêmes marchés.  Le profit lui permettra de faire face aux charges de sa famille. Il rencontre souvent des problèmes de mévente sur le marché. Dans l’avenir, il veut avoir un prêt plus élevé pour pouvoir  augmenter le volume de son activité afin d’avoir plus de profits.
texts.en: Madou is the man holding the cow by a rope in the photo. He is 40 years old and from Mali. He has never received an education. He is a married father to three children, two boys and one girl, who are aged between two and 12 years old. One of his boys is currently attending school. His wife is a housewife. Madou turned to RMCR so he could better run his cow-rearing business, which he has been doing for a very long time. He very much enjoys this activity because it brings many advantages. He gets his livestock from the local markets and resells it at these same markets. The profits will allow him to meet his family's needs. He often encounters slumps in sales at market. In the future, Madou would like to have a much larger loan so he can increase the scale of his business, thereby earning a greater profit.

loans.use: to purchase cows to raise then resell

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es:
En total son 21 mujeres inspiradas que se esfuerzan y que tienen como objetivo principal ser emprendedoras, participan en las capacitaciones en donde pueden notar la importancia de trabajar y obtener mayor ingresos
 Forman parte del comité con el fundamento de ayudarse y más bien consideran una oportunidad de suma importancia.
La Sra. Adorina se siente agradecida por formar parte del grupo e inspirada en esforzarse para poder ayudar a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida. Adorina tiene una panadería y comenta que por medio de su negocio tiene los medios para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ella quiere seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento, es por ello que pide este préstamo, para poder comprar harina en cantidad, levadura, huevos y otros insumos, de manera a seguir mejorando y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
In sum they are 21 inspired women who make an effort and and have a principal objective of being enterprising. They participate in training where one can notice the importance of work and creating greater income. They form part of a committee with the foundation of helping each other and moreover they consider it a most important opportunity.

Adorina feels grateful to form part of the group and inspired to make the effort to help her family and provide them with a higher quality of living. Adorina has a bakery and comments that through her business she has the means to provide her loved ones with a dignified life without hardships.

She wants to continue to grow in her enterprise, so she is requesting this loan to buy flour in bulk, yeast, eggs and other supplies. In this way she can continue to improve and fight to improve her living conditions.She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to grow and improve each day.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, eggs and other supplies.

loans.name: Phalluon

texts.en:
Phalluon, 34, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland that is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Judith is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Gulbara

texts.ru: Гулбара, 28 лет, замужем, есть дочь. Гулбара в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, она на сегодняшний день имеет: 2 коровы, 12 овец, также есть 1,0 Га земли, где выращивает арбузы. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 14,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулбара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) для покупки удобрений для выращивания органических арбузов. Гулбара намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита она хочет вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulbara is 28 years old, she is married, and she has a daughter. To provide for her family Gulbara does cattle breeding and field crop cultivation. She strated 5 years ago with 5000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work she now has 2 cows, 12 sheep, and also 1 Ha of land, where she grows watermelons. Her total monthly earnings are 14,500 som (KGS). 
In order to develop her farm, Gulbara applied for a 25,000 som (KGS) loan from Bai Tushum Bank to purchase fertilizer for growing organic watermelons. Gulbara plans to have a good harvest, which would definitely lead to the increase of her family's welfare.  Gulbara wants to invest the income from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for land cultivation and growing organic watermelons
